Sovi 11/11/2025 4:29 PM
does switch-trigger stop on first true condition in ck3 script?
Sovi
does switch-trigger stop on first true condition in ck3 script?
Pep 11/11/2025 4:30 PM
Yes.
Pep
Yes.
Sovi 11/11/2025 4:30 PM
ty
Pep 11/11/2025 4:32 PM
So for that reason, for lengthy switches or switches that are used multiple times in the same tick, i.e. they could be used as a consequence of a list builder iterator, you should place the most likely true cases at the start of the switch. (edited)

Here‚Äôs the code I‚Äôm using: if = { limit = { scope:occupant = character:bookmark_huang_chao } scope:occupant = { trigger_event = gahc_huang_chao.0001 } } When I put this block inside the ### IMPRISON AND KILL EFFECTS ### every_in_list = { list = captured_targets_effects ... } loop, it fires once for every captured character, which makes sense. But if I move it after that loop (so it should only fire once, after all captures are processed), it never fires at all ‚Äî not even once. Does anyone know why this happens? (edited)
Gally
Hey everyone, I‚Äôm working on modifying siege.0001 and trying to trigger a custom event gahc_huang_chao.0001 after prisoners are captured. Here‚Äôs the code I‚Äôm using: if = { limit = { scope:occupant = character:bookmark_huang_chao } scope:occupant = { trigger_event = gahc_huang_chao.0001 } } When I put this block inside the ### IMPRISON AND KILL EFFECTS ### every_in_list = { list = captured_targets_effects ... } loop, it fires once for every captured character, which makes sense. !scriptdocs
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/12/2025 10:30 AM
The most complete and up-to-date resource of script is the script logs: by running the console command script_docs in game, a number of different files are put in your logs folder that list all available triggers, effects, modifiers, and more. Find the logs folder here:
  • Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs on Windows
  • "$HOME/.local/share/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs" on Linux

The most complete and up-to-date resource of script is the script logs: by running the console command script_docs in game, a number of different files are put in your logs folder that list all available triggers, effects, modifiers, and more. Find the logs folder here:

FizCap 11/12/2025 12:01 PM
riseandfall_war_won_defender = { trigger = { has_game_rule = riseandfall_realm_stability_enabled } effect = { # Root scope: none; event provides scope:attacker and scope:defender # Apply loss to attacker. Apply victory effect to defender only for non-peasant wars scope:attacker = { riseandfall_war_loss_se = yes } if = { limit = { scope:war = { NOT = { using_cb = peasant_war } } } scope:defender = { riseandfall_war_victory_se = yes } } } } this is a code i wrote for my mod for scoping out specific wars
Badal Chovo

riseandfall_war_won_defender = { trigger = { has_game_rule = riseandfall_realm_stability_enabled } effect = { # Root scope: none; event provides scope:attacker and scope:defender # Apply loss to attacker. Apply victory effect to defender only for non-peasant wars scope:attacker = { riseandfall_war_loss_se = yes } if = { limit = { scope:war = { NOT = { using_cb = peasant_war } } } scope:defender = { riseandfall_war_victory_se = yes } } } } this is a code i wrote for my mod for scoping out specific wars

Canny 11/12/2025 12:14 PM
just think of scope as giving a nickname to someone. save_scope_as = test_char can be accessed by scope:test_char
12:15 PM
it also helps keep track of people throughout events or to pass scopes to whatever comes next
12:16 PM
on_actions and character_interactions also provide their own scopes.
Canny
just think of scope as giving a nickname to someone. save_scope_as = test_char can be accessed by scope:test_char

Canny 11/12/2025 12:18 PM
the context of your events matters in this case, like how is the event called. Via decisions, character_interactions or on_actions. Most of them already come with their own scopes you can just access
Canny
the context of your events matters in this case, like how is the event called. Via decisions, character_interactions or on_actions. Most of them already come with their own scopes you can just access

Canny 11/12/2025 12:20 PM
something like top_liege = { save_scope_as = top_liege } saves top_liege as scope:top_liege (edited)

Canny 11/12/2025 12:24 PM

Canny 11/12/2025 12:25 PM
but in your case, you gotta plan out the flow of events, like from the on_action, are you gonna send an event to the vassals or the primary_defender or attacker or all participants, etc.
Canny
but in your case, you gotta plan out the flow of events, like from the on_action, are you gonna send an event to the vassals or the primary_defender or attacker or all participants, etc.
Badal Chovo 11/12/2025 12:26 PM

Canny 11/12/2025 12:27 PM
the on_action for on_war_started already provides you with scope:defender and scope:attacker without you needing to save it. You can then reach the vassal with every_vassal or every_vassal_or_below and trigger an event there.
Canny
the on_action for on_war_started already provides you with scope:defender and scope:attacker without you needing to save it. You can then reach the vassal with every_vassal or every_vassal_or_below and trigger an event there.

12:33 PM
every_vassal = { limit = { primary_defender = scope:liege scope:war = { war_goal = { target = { any_held_title = { holder = scope:root } } } { save_scope_as = war } } } scope:war = { add_defender = ROOT } } (edited)
12:33 PM
Is the above code any better?
Canny 11/12/2025 12:34 PM
my advice is that before you worry about the effects, try to make sure the flow of events are right
12:34 PM
make a war on_action first, add it to the on_war_started on_actions. Check if the vassals receive an event if their liege gets attacked in a war
12:35 PM
then you can refine the conditions and effects
Canny
my advice is that before you worry about the effects, try to make sure the flow of events are right

Canny 11/12/2025 12:38 PM
to make use of the scopes from the on_action...
12:39 PM
scope:war for example is already provided, as is scope:defender and scope:attacker which is basically all you need
12:42 PM
if you wanna get something like: top_liege = { every_character_war = { limit = { primary_defender = prev # blablabla } add_defender = ROOT # something happens } } so you can do that just to have an effect that works. I dont see any point in saving scopes in your case
Canny
if you wanna get something like: top_liege = { every_character_war = { limit = { primary_defender = prev # blablabla } add_defender = ROOT # something happens } } so you can do that just to have an effect that works. I dont see any point in saving scopes in your case

KeizerHarm | T4N 11/12/2025 1:27 PM
But you're making up new words and expecting them to work
1:28 PM
That's just not going to work. You must not write and then hope it works. You must:
  • think what you need
  • look up how you need to write it
  • write it
1:28 PM
In that order
KeizerHarm | T4N
That's just not going to work. You must not write and then hope it works. You must:
  • think what you need
  • look up how you need to write it
  • write it

1:32 PM

Pep 11/12/2025 6:16 PM
Fun fact: You can test absolutely anything and everything every easily. Try it one way, if it works great, if not then try another way, rinse/repeat.
6:19 PM
You're not asking how but if and if's you can test yourself. When you have exhausted every if you can think off but now know exactly what you are trying to do and what didn't work, then you can try asking how or just skip straight to asking how if you have an exact scenario you can explain.
6:20 PM
And when you do ask how or even if, you just have to wait patiently for an answer.
Thecat 11/12/2025 8:58 PM

8:58 PM
also is unexpected token always a bad thing
8:59 PM
like this on-action I made, is there a way for this to work better? Or is it even doing its job
a 11/12/2025 9:02 PM
where else do you think it would be automatically referenced
9:03 PM
trigger is just the trigger part to validate the rest of the on_action you don't shove the events part inside
a
trigger is just the trigger part to validate the rest of the on_action you don't shove the events part inside
Thecat 11/12/2025 9:12 PM
okay so I should have the events part taken out of that loop good to know
9:12 PM

9:13 PM

a 11/12/2025 9:20 PM
if is used for logic in effects, prefix it into trigger_if for conditional limits
9:20 PM
you've read the wiki intro to modding?
Thecat 11/12/2025 9:21 PM
not fully but its mainly because I opted for a deep dive into the actual code components, which means I probably should go back and make sure to read through the wiki in full
a 11/12/2025 9:21 PM
https://ck3.paradoxwikis.com/Event_modding#On_Actions_(on_action)
Thecat 11/12/2025 9:25 PM
Is it best to put the event target in the on_action or the event itself? I am targeting just one person so I was unsure
Thecat
Is it best to put the event target in the on_action or the event itself? I am targeting just one person so I was unsure
Pep 11/12/2025 10:36 PM
For a brief description of on_actions my_on_action = { events = { # these events will be fired when the on_action is triggered # provided their own trigger allows them to be executed } random_events = { 10 = # one of these events will be fired 10 = # when the on_action is triggered, providing the event's trigger allows execution } first_valid = { # the first event in this list that is allowed to execute by it's own trigger will be executed } trigger = { # this allows the on_action to be triggered } effect = { # this is where you do any effects you want to do when the on_action is triggered # # triggering an event in here allows you to control whether the event should be triggered at all # and allows you to set up additional scopes for the event } } Read the .info file in common_on_action for more information. (edited)
Thecat 11/12/2025 10:37 PM
okay sweet thank you for the help
Pep
You're not asking how but if and if's you can test yourself. When you have exhausted every if you can think off but now know exactly what you are trying to do and what didn't work, then you can try asking how or just skip straight to asking how if you have an exact scenario you can explain.

Thecat 11/12/2025 10:52 PM
Yeah its a strange one, the main issue is it causes a yearly debuff on the dynastic cycle for having a disaster. So completing the project seems to not properly activate this scripted_effect attempt_delete_natural_disaster_situation_effect = { scope:situation ?= { if = { limit = { any_situation_county = { count = 0 } NOT = { any_situation_participant = { NOT = { this = root } is_ai = no } } } end_situation = yes } } } (edited)
10:53 PM
what I am most confused about is the count = 0 part
10:54 PM
this is vanilla code, and the glitch is in base game so I wonder what "end_situation" is doing in the background
Pep 11/12/2025 10:57 PM
Well any_situation_county = { count = 0 } is imho a horrid way of writing not = { any_situation_county = {} } Like I said, I don't know if it is a glitch because I don't know what is going on behind the scenes, it could well be WAI if it's performing housekeeping. BTW you can format a block of code better if you start and end the block with a line that only consists of three `
Pep
Well any_situation_county = { count = 0 } is imho a horrid way of writing not = { any_situation_county = {} } Like I said, I don't know if it is a glitch because I don't know what is going on behind the scenes, it could well be WAI if it's performing housekeeping. BTW you can format a block of code better if you start and end the block with a line that only consists of three `
Thecat 11/12/2025 10:58 PM

10:58 PM

kcajkcaj | AGoT 11/12/2025 11:27 PM
IIRC they've been phasing out nots for performance reasons. Not sure why nots casue performance issues, but there have been a lot of changes away from it recently
Thecat
they should probably make it all into situations
kcajkcaj | AGoT 11/12/2025 11:27 PM
IIRC they specifically said they wouldn't for compatibility reasons, but I agree. Also, I think Struggles do a lot of the figuring out which cultures/faiths/rulers are involved in code, whereas with Situations you'd have to do it in script.
Pep 11/12/2025 11:28 PM
Yeah they have but not in all situations. However that doesn't change the fact that I think any_ = { count = 0 } is horrid
kcajkcaj | AGoT 11/12/2025 11:29 PM
Oh yeah I agree that there's a lot of script thats been looking ugly as a result of this
Pep 11/12/2025 11:30 PM
From what I saw when I did my sandbox upgrade, they seem to have only retrospectively changed not = {} where whatever it is in rose to the top of their profiling charts. Not sure if attempt_delete_natural_disaster_situation_effect would have done so tbh
11:30 PM
Then again I don't know how often that check is polled.

Has anyone else encountered the invisible artifacts bug? In what way is this a limitation?
Pep 11/13/2025 7:53 AM
Dunno I don't have the issue. I've seen some people say it's a ck3 limitation because you have too many mods loaded so ck3 stops loading parts of gfx when it runs out of memory, others then claim it's specific mods, which others then claim they don't subscribe to nor ever have but still have the issue, go back to the beginning and start again for a never ending round of it's this mod but I don't have that mod debate, always ending with too many mods. It does appear to be a vanilla bug/issue. But everyone seems to be sure that although they are invisible the artifacts are placed, so they are getting the buffs. If any/all of that is true the limitation seems to be that you just don't see your artifacts

KeizerHarm | T4N 11/13/2025 7:57 AM
It's a memory limitation introduced with Khans of the Steppe. As enough entities are loaded, their references start overloading each other. It's being worked on by the programmers

Pep 11/13/2025 8:14 AM
Depends on what the actual issue is. If it's simply a case of a fixed reserve memory space to hold the list of artifacts and destroying one does actually free it's slot then maybe. But if destroying one doesn't free the slot or it's simply a count of the number of created thus far and destroying one doesn't decrement that count, then you can't do anything. Or it could be something else entirely, the point is it's a blackbox bug that we probably can't affect.
8:15 AM
Given the visual gravity of the bug, I'm sure pdox devs would have fixed it instantly if it was trivial.
Pep
Depends on what the actual issue is. If it's simply a case of a fixed reserve memory space to hold the list of artifacts and destroying one does actually free it's slot then maybe. But if destroying one doesn't free the slot or it's simply a count of the number of created thus far and destroying one doesn't decrement that count, then you can't do anything. Or it could be something else entirely, the point is it's a blackbox bug that we probably can't affect.

Pep 11/13/2025 8:53 AM

8:54 AM
Ourg 11/13/2025 9:21 AM
I'm looking at the from dust event (recovering from epidemic) and i don't get the logic in the trigger this effect is called from on_province_recovered plague_recovery_event_effect = { scope:epidemic = { save_scope_as = epidemic } county.holder.liege = { add_to_variable_list = { name = formerly_infected_counties target = root.county years = 10 } if = { limit = { any_sub_realm_county = { any_county_province = { count = 1 any_province_epidemic = { count = 1 } } } } trigger_event = { id = epidemic_events.0110 days = 1 } } } } and the trigger of the event : trigger = { exists = scope:epidemic # Make sure no new plagues showed up since then, or a new preferred capital county has not been chosen already NOT = { any_sub_realm_county = { OR = { has_province_with_epidemic = { intensity = any } has_variable = preferred_capital_chosen } } } OR = { #You're either not on cooldown OR the Black Death NOT = { has_variable = had_recent_prosperity_event_var } scope:epidemic = { epidemic_type.epidemic_trait = trait:bubonic_plague outbreak_intensity = apocalyptic } } has_variable_list = formerly_infected_counties }
9:21 AM

Speedweed|MedievalImmersion| 11/13/2025 7:54 PM
Question, does adding DLC as a requirement for a mod on steam prevent users from accessing DLC exclusive content through the mod or do I need bake in more bespoke code to ensure that doesn‚Äôt happen?
Thecat 11/13/2025 8:13 PM
I have a code block I am looking for feedback on, I designed it to work with a variable and then remove the variable after one day it is likely not a great looking code block but I am wondering if there is a better way to trigger a situation type from random list if a county province is coastal (edited)
8:13 PM
$COUNTY$ = { save_scope_as = epicenter_county } # Track globally for exclusivity and distribution if= { limit = { has_game_rule = disaster_more_disasters } if = { #figures out if epicenter is coastal then makes it a random chance to fire a Tsunami limit = { $COUNTY$ = { has_coastal_province = yes } } random = { chance = 50 start_situation = { type = natural_disaster_coastal_earthquake save_scope_as = situation } set_variable = { name = tsunami_earthquake value = yes days = 1 } } if = { limit = { NOT = { exists = var:tsunami_earthquake } } start_situation = { type = natural_disaster_earthquake save_scope_as = situation } } } else = { start_situation = { type = natural_disaster_earthquake save_scope_as = situation } } } else_if = { limit = { has_game_rule = disaster_vanilla_disasters } start_situation = { type = natural_disaster_earthquake save_scope_as = situation } } else = { }
8:14 PM
Like I basically just make the variable temporary for a day as it really only needs it for the yearly global scheduling pulse

Thecat 11/13/2025 9:49 PM
fp1_pillage_legacy_3 = { # Practiced Kidnappers legacy = fp1_pillage_legacy_track effect = { # +X% extra chance to kidnap characters after sieges/raids. custom_description_no_bullet = { text = fp1_pillage_legacy_3_effect } } }
Pep 11/13/2025 9:49 PM
iirc it was along the lines of calculating the character's worth based on various factors then using that value to fall within a range in the trigger but script values are calculated on each use, there's no cache. (edited)
Thecat 11/13/2025 9:50 PM
oh wait
9:50 PM
no I am dumb
9:51 PM
siege_base_capture_chance = { value = 35 # Dynasty Perk: Practiced Kidnappers if = { limit = { scope:occupant = { dynasty ?= { has_dynasty_perk = fp1_pillage_legacy_3 } } } add = 20 } # peasants capture and kill more nobles if = { limit = { scope:occupant = { has_variable = rebel_leader_peasants } is_lowborn = no } add = 20 } # Cultural Parameter: State Ransoms if = { limit = { OR = { # Either you're involved in large groups of the holding surrendering... scope:barony.culture = { has_cultural_parameter = knights_die_less_but_are_captured_more } # ... or you know your liege will pay your ransom. scope:barony.holder.culture = { has_cultural_parameter = knights_die_less_but_are_captured_more } } # Ransoms or no, the primary participants & their heirs know better than to surrender. character_is_potential_valuable_prisoner = no # And independent characters likewise have no incentive. top_liege != this } add = 50 } }
9:55 PM
on_commander_combat_finished = { trigger = { scope:victory = no } events = { # DISABLED as how this is handled is undergoing a rework. #commanders.0011 # Commander captured after combat. } } # called on every unique owner of an army on combat end # root is the owning character # scope:combat_side is the side of combat the commander is on # scope:victory is whether the commander's side won # commanders is a list of all commanders in the combat # knights is a list of all knights in the combat on_army_combat_finished = { }
9:57 PM

Badal Chovo 11/14/2025 8:13 AM

Pep 11/14/2025 8:16 AM
Can't remember exactly where in the file but if you can't find it with simple searches like realm law or even law then you'll have to do what the rest of us have to do, which is to start the game in debug mode and use the tools available in there to identify events, gui, etc And no I can't remember what the tools are or where they are, you'll have to dig around. Failing that, while in -debug -devel mode you can edit the gui file to find areas on screen by adding in a visible background to different sections to see how they change on screen when you save the file.
Agami 11/14/2025 8:23 AM
let me guide you through the steps 1. search through localziation for the name of the thing that will tell you that "guaranteed protection" is called top_liege_redirected_to_border_wars_law 2. search for that in the common folder you'll find the laws, and now you can search for their names and parameters 3. searching in gui for the flag 'imperial policy', gives us vbox_law_item at line 4083 that checks that the law has imperial_policy flag
8:23 AM
ergo, if you add that flag to your law, it should appear there
Agami
let me guide you through the steps 1. search through localziation for the name of the thing that will tell you that "guaranteed protection" is called top_liege_redirected_to_border_wars_law 2. search for that in the common folder you'll find the laws, and now you can search for their names and parameters 3. searching in gui for the flag 'imperial policy', gives us vbox_law_item at line 4083 that checks that the law has imperial_policy flag

Agami 11/14/2025 10:20 AM
days = 7 or years = 7
10:20 AM

10:22 AM

What is the significance of the "index" value, in the genes code? Example: western_imperial_clothes = { index = 6 male = { ..... etc. Do I need to worry about the index I set here conflicting with other mods that might use the same index value? If so, can I minimize the chances of this by picking an arbitrary, large value?
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/14/2025 2:46 PM
Yup, it's a big hassle
2:47 PM
You even gotta update them every patch when paradox adds new assets
2:47 PM
You can get around it by making a completely separate gene group that only has your own genes in it
2:47 PM
And then use portrait modifiers that disable the vanilla gene group completely while only selecting from yours
2:48 PM
It's a bit janky but it saves a lot of headache on patch day
King Spork 11/14/2025 2:49 PM
@Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings If I'm creating my own culture with its own culture GFX tag, will it still try to use vanilla portrait modifiers? My reading of the code is that I'll have to create my own custom modifiers/triggers to match the gfx tag in my culture, and if I do that, I won't have to worry about it conflicting with vanilla. Is that correct?
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/14/2025 2:50 PM
Yes it will always try to use vanilla portrait modifiers
2:51 PM
If you want to stop it from doing that use your own group of portrait modifiers in a file lexicographically later than the vanilla ones, and whenever you set an asset you disable the vanilla equivalent slot
2:51 PM
Then the game will go 1. Selecting a vanilla portrait modifier, equipping the clothes 2. Selecting your modifier, replacing the vanilla clothes with yours (if it qualifies) (edited)
1
King Spork 11/14/2025 2:52 PM
How do I accomplish this part: whenever you set an asset you disable the vanilla equivalent slot
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/14/2025 2:52 PM
Set the vanilla one to the default asset. Naked, or no_cloak, or whatnot
2:52 PM
Each asset group/gene group has their own default
King Spork 11/14/2025 2:53 PM
Do I do that in the trigger code? Or the portrait modifier code? or the genes code?
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/14/2025 2:55 PM
Portrait modifier
2:55 PM
Portrait modifiers set gene values for gene groups
2:55 PM
And they get weighted by triggers
1

2:59 PM
not really clear what "add = 50" means in that context either
3:05 PM
Ah I see... there's a file 01_clothes_base is gfx/portrait_modifiers, that must be what you're talking about
Pep
You can get the trait xp using "has_trait_xp(lifestyle_hunter|falconer)"

1
Thecat 11/14/2025 10:23 PM
It's difficult to search this up so I thought I'd ask what "?="Means in the code I've seen it mainly in scope targets
Pep 11/14/2025 10:24 PM
!?=
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/14/2025 10:24 PM
?= is useful syntax to avoid the need to check if the scope it opens exists. It just abbreviates what you could write before. In triggers: AND = { exists = scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist = { some_trigger = yes } } Can now be written as scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist ?= { some_trigger = yes } In effects: if = { limit = { exists = scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist } scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist = { some_effect = yes } } Can now be written as: scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist ?= { some_effect = yes }
YAGPDB.xyz
?= is useful syntax to avoid the need to check if the scope it opens exists. It just abbreviates what you could write before. In triggers: AND = { exists = scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist = { some_trigger = yes } } Can now be written as scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist ?= { some_trigger = yes } In effects: if = { limit = { exists = scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist } scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist = { some_effect = yes } } Can now be written as: scope:a_scope_that_may_not_exist ?= { some_effect = yes }
Thecat 11/14/2025 10:29 PM
Ah I see thank you

Pep 11/15/2025 6:07 AM

Benismann 11/15/2025 6:07 AM

7:12 AM

GetCharacterDeathName = { type = character text = { setup_scope = { save_scope_as = custom_loc_character scope:dead_ruler_title ?= { save_scope_as = custom_loc_title } } trigger = { scope:custom_loc_title = { exists = yes } } localization_key = title_dead_ruler_of_state_custom_loc } text = { setup_scope = { save_scope_as = custom_loc_character } localization_key = "[dead_ruler_title.GetNameNoTier]" } }

trigger = { scope:custom_loc_title = { exists = yes } } Is just wrong, should be trigger = { exists = scope:custom_loc_title } But why are you even saving scope:dead_ruler_title as a new scope? (edited)

Pep 11/15/2025 7:29 AM
Custom loc is fun until it isn't
Galle 11/15/2025 7:29 AM
God custom loc was so much easier in CK2
7:30 AM
Anyway, what confuses me most is that the wrong localization key is being used
7:30 AM
It should use title_dead_ruler_of_state_custom_loc
7:30 AM
But instead it appears to be deciding that dead_ruler_title doesn't exist (even though you can clearly see that it does) and running the backup key
Galle
It should use title_dead_ruler_of_state_custom_loc
Pep 11/15/2025 7:32 AM
Well you can simplify it by not re-saving the scope and just do trigger = { exists = scope:dead_ruler_title } Then use dead_ruler_title in your localization. If it uses the wrong localization then scope:dead_ruler_title does not exist, which saving it as a new scope would not have solved. Always strive to simplify, never complicate
Galle 11/15/2025 7:34 AM
Okay, but that still doesn't solve the underlying problem, which is that scope:dead_ruler_title does exist, you can see it right there in the list of debug options.

7:39 AM

7:41 AM

Pep 11/15/2025 7:43 AM
ooh, wait If you can actually access the corpse in your custom loc, you could save a dead_var on them, then save the dead_var to a scope in your custom loc, which might then expose that scope to localization (edited)
Jackie 11/15/2025 7:59 AM
Is there a way to make concubine and marriage events respect special rules you apply? (If I get the event ids) (edited)
8:00 AM
There's so many events that just completely ignore any rules, even preferences, and force your dynasty to marry or partake in concubinage outside of what they should.
Pep 11/15/2025 8:03 AM
A big part of marriage and concubinage is controlled by a few triggers, so that would be the first place to start. But you would also have to find every place that actually marries and makes concubines to ensure those triggers are used or add lightweight alternatives if the individual case doesn't warrant using the triggers.
Pep
A big part of marriage and concubinage is controlled by a few triggers, so that would be the first place to start. But you would also have to find every place that actually marries and makes concubines to ensure those triggers are used or add lightweight alternatives if the individual case doesn't warrant using the triggers.
Jackie 11/15/2025 8:04 AM

8:04 AM
I am looking for them, but do we know how many events were added in All under heaven specifically?
Pep 11/15/2025 8:07 AM
I don't think anyone has published a list of new AUH events but you can do a diff between the two versions to find the new events. There's only around 110 marriage effects used in vanilla and around 25 concubinage effect uses but that won't catch any that are done in other mods.
Jackie 11/15/2025 8:08 AM

8:08 AM

Pep 11/15/2025 8:08 AM
Oh I meant 3rd party mods.
Jackie 11/15/2025 8:09 AM

Pep 11/15/2025 8:11 AM
Any other mod in your playset could have marriages, so if they don't use the vanilla triggers and just do something like root = { marry = scope:some_character } then your dynasty members could still be married to unworthy spouses.
8:12 AM
There's no way you could prevent that without a compatch

AugustJo 11/15/2025 2:05 PM
Is it possible to reveal/learn all schemes that are targeting You or Your dynasty?
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420 11/15/2025 2:22 PM
[00:42:44][E][character_interaction.cpp:930]: requiem_gallery_queue_prisoner_interaction: 'ai_potential' added, but no 'ai_frequency' or 'ai_frequency_by_tier', won't be used [00:42:44][E][character_interaction.cpp:930]: requiem_gallery_unqueue_prisoner_interaction: 'ai_potential' added, but no 'ai_frequency' or 'ai_frequency_by_tier', won't be used Anyone knows what is going on with these errors?, I am making my first mod that expands the torture interactions and some interactions i do not want the npcs to use them and i set the ai potential ai frequency and frequency by tier what should I do will npcs respect the rule of not using said interactions or of because of the error they will ignore it
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420
[00:42:44][E][character_interaction.cpp:930]: requiem_gallery_queue_prisoner_interaction: 'ai_potential' added, but no 'ai_frequency' or 'ai_frequency_by_tier', won't be used [00:42:44][E][character_interaction.cpp:930]: requiem_gallery_unqueue_prisoner_interaction: 'ai_potential' added, but no 'ai_frequency' or 'ai_frequency_by_tier', won't be used Anyone knows what is going on with these errors?, I am making my first mod that expands the torture interactions and some interactions i do not want the npcs to use them and i set the ai potential ai frequency and frequency by tier what should I do will npcs respect the rule of not using said interactions or of because of the error they will ignore it
Pep 11/15/2025 4:09 PM
If you simply don't want ai to use your interaction then just add is_ai = no to the is_shown trigger because they can't use an interaction that they cannot see. If you use ai_potential then you have to also use either ai_frequency or ai_frequency_by_tier too.
AugustJo
Is it possible to reveal/learn all schemes that are targeting You or Your dynasty?
Pep 11/15/2025 4:24 PM
To see all schemes against a character use the any_targeting_scheme trigger and every_targeting_scheme effect. To see schemes against all members of a character's dynasty/house, you have to find all members of the character's dynasty/house and then use those effect/trigger for them. To see schemes for a character scope:some_character ?= { if = { limit = { any_targeting_scheme = {} } every_targeting_scheme = { # do something } } } To see schemes for a character and members of their dynasty scope:some_character ?= { dynasty ?= { every_dynasty_member = { if = { limit = { any_targeting_scheme = {} } every_targeting_scheme = { # do something } } } } } You can use house ?= every_house_member = {} if you want to check your house rather than the whole dynasty. Obviously the dynasty/house versions includes the character because they are a member of their own dynasty/house.
Hundevakt 11/15/2025 4:30 PM
Does anyone know in which file I can find the variable that determines how much advantage my commander receives from his martial stat during battles?
Pep
If you simply don't want ai to use your interaction then just add is_ai = no to the is_shown trigger because they can't use an interaction that they cannot see. If you use ai_potential then you have to also use either ai_frequency or ai_frequency_by_tier too.
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420 11/15/2025 5:08 PM
Got it thanks for support and clarification! I appreciate the help and I apologize for the late response.
Hundevakt
Does anyone know in which file I can find the variable that determines how much advantage my commander receives from his martial stat during battles?
Agami 11/15/2025 5:09 PM
I think that's hardcoded
5:10 PM
there is a advantage_damage_effect game rule, but the options there probably can't be changed, they are listed in the .info file as the few predefined flags (edited)
1
Hundevakt 11/15/2025 5:35 PM
OK, thanks. Thought maybe it would be changeable like the opinion modifier from diplo or the domain limit from stewardship
Agami 11/15/2025 5:49 PM
keep in mind there is also a define that changes the bonus from advantage
5:49 PM
ADVANTAGE_DAMAGE_SCALING_FACTOR = 5 # How much should the advantage affect damage given
Prof.Dr.Linux 11/15/2025 5:49 PM
Hey, does anybody know how to work with custom CBs? I wanted to create a CB that would destroy the primary title of the defender, but the CB name is empty, and it doesn't seem to work. Any kind of advice is welcome. https://pastebin.com/kWz3wYJY
fracture_all_kingdoms_cb = { group = subjugation icon = subjugat...
Pastebin.com is the number one paste tool since 2002. Pastebin is a website where you can store text online for a set period of time.
Agami 11/15/2025 5:51 PM
not sure about the name, but this wouldn'd work: any_held_title = { limit = { tier = tier_kingdom } destroy_title = this } it should be every_held_title, not any
1
5:51 PM
every is an effect, any is a trigger
5:51 PM
check your error log, it would complain about this an any other errors there
5:51 PM
!errorlog
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/15/2025 5:51 PM
The error.log can be one of the most useful tools in modding, giving you plenty of tidbits and details into why something likely didn't work! Find the error.log in the logs folder
  • Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs on Windows
  • "$HOME/.local/share/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs" on Linux
Prof.Dr.Linux 11/15/2025 5:52 PM
ok thanky will do
Agami 11/15/2025 5:53 PM
also, note this destroy_title - Destroys a title Supported Scopes: character Supported Targets: landed_title
5:53 PM
this effect needs to be used on a character
5:54 PM
so as odd as it looks, you'd need to do this every_held_title = { limit = { tier = tier_kingdom } prev = { destroy_title = prev } }
5:54 PM
first prev goes to the character, second prev returns the title
Prof.Dr.Linux 11/15/2025 5:58 PM
thx worked like a charm
AugustJo 11/15/2025 6:28 PM

a 11/15/2025 6:41 PM
check every_living_character's real_father (or real_mother if you're into that stuff) compared to the player character
AugustJo
Is it possible to cleanly find out who all your biological children are?
Pep 11/15/2025 6:43 PM
Check out my Wild Oats mod if you want a mod to do that or want some ideas how to do that. https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2834149196
Steam Workshop::Wild Oats
Jackie 11/15/2025 7:05 PM
Is it possible to make a mod where it checks if characters have a pure blooded trait, then auto remove/dismiss concubines/spouses without that trait?
Jackie
Is it possible to make a mod where it checks if characters have a pure blooded trait, then auto remove/dismiss concubines/spouses without that trait?
Pep 11/15/2025 7:07 PM
Checking a trait Remove spouse Remove concubine Automatically check and do those things periodically (edited)
Pep
Checking a trait Remove spouse Remove concubine Automatically check and do those things periodically (edited)
Jackie 11/15/2025 7:10 PM
thanks
7:10 PM
Think it would lag the game too much to check for it?
Pep 11/15/2025 7:12 PM
Depends how often you check and who you check. Checking everyone is expensive, especially late game. Checking only playable characters is less expensive. Blocking marriage and concubinage before it happens is far less expensive but unfortunately there will be edge cases that don't marry or take concubines through the marriage/concubinage scripts. (edited)
Jackie 11/15/2025 7:13 PM
Yeah
7:14 PM
It‚Äôs more for a quick fix last ditch mod, so even if it‚Äôs a bit expensive i‚Äôll probably check all in a player dynasty maybe. (edited)
Pep
Depends how often you check and who you check. Checking everyone is expensive, especially late game. Checking only playable characters is less expensive. Blocking marriage and concubinage before it happens is far less expensive but unfortunately there will be edge cases that don't marry or take concubines through the marriage/concubinage scripts. (edited)

Pep 11/15/2025 7:16 PM

King Spork 11/15/2025 8:03 PM
Hello, I'm stuck trying to figure out how to create a visual style for my culture. Clothing style is set in the culture files like this: clothing_gfx = { byzantine_clothing_gfx } How do I create my own clothing set for my culture? clothing_gfx = { my_custom_clothing_gfx } To be clear, I'm not trying to use my own clothing assets, I just want to create a custom set of vanilla clothes that the engine can pick from to dress the characters in my custom culture. What are all the steps I need to take to make this happen? I know it has something to do with portrait modifiers? But I'm not sure what else I need to do.
King Spork
Hello, I'm stuck trying to figure out how to create a visual style for my culture. Clothing style is set in the culture files like this: clothing_gfx = { byzantine_clothing_gfx } How do I create my own clothing set for my culture? clothing_gfx = { my_custom_clothing_gfx } To be clear, I'm not trying to use my own clothing assets, I just want to create a custom set of vanilla clothes that the engine can pick from to dress the characters in my custom culture. What are all the steps I need to take to make this happen? I know it has something to do with portrait modifiers? But I'm not sure what else I need to do.
Pep 11/15/2025 8:09 PM
Search gfx/portraits/ for portrait_byzantine_clothing_trigger The results should give you an idea of how you can link clothing to your my_custom_clothing_gfx
1
8:11 PM
You would also have to create a portrait_my_custom_clothing_gfx_trigger so look through common/scripted_triggers/ for portrait_byzantine_clothing_trigger and use that as a template, iirc it is in 00_clothing_triggers.txt, you can put your one in a new file.
King Spork 11/15/2025 8:17 PM
Awesome, thanks. So let me see if I understand this... western_stealth = { dna_modifiers = { accessory = { mode = add gene = clothes template = western_stealth range = { 0 1 } # For the randomness to work correctly } } weight = { base = 0 modifier = { add = 110 portrait_stealth_trigger = yes OR = { portrait_byzantine_clothing_trigger = yes portrait_northern_clothing_trigger = yes portrait_western_clothing_trigger = yes } } } } In this example, template = western_stealth defines the clothing assets to be used? And the weight section defines the likelyhood the clothes will be chosen, with a modifer being added based on some conditions. In this example, if one of the listed clothing_triggers is true and portrait_stealth_trigger is true, the modifier will be applied. Is that correct?
Pep 11/15/2025 8:18 PM
Yep
8:18 PM
So you just add your portrait_my_custom_clothing_gfx_trigger trigger to the OR = {} in the modifier (edited)
King Spork 11/15/2025 8:19 PM
where is the western_stealth template defined? In other words how do I actually pick the clothing items that will be applied if western_stealth is applied by the engine?
8:19 PM
or is western_stealth just one clothing item?
Pep 11/15/2025 8:19 PM
Search gfx/
King Spork
where is the western_stealth template defined? In other words how do I actually pick the clothing items that will be applied if western_stealth is applied by the engine?
Pep 11/15/2025 8:21 PM

ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420 11/15/2025 11:08 PM
In CK3 script, what‚Äôs the correct way to enforce a hard cap like ‚Äòno more than 10 characters with a given flag‚Äô in an interaction trigger? Is there a count_character (or similar count) trigger that lets me do something like: count_character = { limit = { has_character_flag = my_flag } value < 10 } Or, if not, what‚Äôs the recommended pattern for checking ‚Äònumber of courtiers with my_flag < 10‚Äô inside is_valid_showing_failures_only for an interaction? (edited)
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420
In CK3 script, what‚Äôs the correct way to enforce a hard cap like ‚Äòno more than 10 characters with a given flag‚Äô in an interaction trigger? Is there a count_character (or similar count) trigger that lets me do something like: count_character = { limit = { has_character_flag = my_flag } value < 10 } Or, if not, what‚Äôs the recommended pattern for checking ‚Äònumber of courtiers with my_flag < 10‚Äô inside is_valid_showing_failures_only for an interaction? (edited)
Pep 11/16/2025 12:44 AM
Can't think of a built-in to do that, it's late for me so there may be one But you can do what you want with a script value count_courtiers_value = { every_courtier = { limit = { has_character_flag = my_flag } add = 1 } } Stick that Ô∏è in a file in common/script_values/ then in your interaction is_valid_showing_failures_only = { scope:actor = { count_courtiers_value < 10 } } Someone may come along with a better way but I can't think of one atm I'm off to
Pep
Can't think of a built-in to do that, it's late for me so there may be one But you can do what you want with a script value count_courtiers_value = { every_courtier = { limit = { has_character_flag = my_flag } add = 1 } } Stick that Ô∏è in a file in common/script_values/ then in your interaction is_valid_showing_failures_only = { scope:actor = { count_courtiers_value < 10 } } Someone may come along with a better way but I can't think of one atm I'm off to
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420 11/16/2025 1:08 AM

Agami
in vanilla earthquakes are started with this effect spawn_earthquake_in_county_effect you can give it a specific county and it will use its capital province like this set_situation_center_province = scope:epicenter_county.title_province

requiem_tribunal_initiate_interaction = { is_valid_showing_failures_only = { scope:actor = { custom_tooltip = { text = requiem_tribunal_full_tt NOT = { any_courtier = { has_character_flag = requiem_tribunal_member_flag count >= 6 } } } } } on_accept = { scope:recipient = { save_scope_as = tribunal_candidate } scope:actor = { trigger_event = { id = requiem_prison.3000 } } } } (edited)
ViktorReznov - NachoLibre420
requiem_tribunal_initiate_interaction = { is_valid_showing_failures_only = { scope:actor = { custom_tooltip = { text = requiem_tribunal_full_tt NOT = { any_courtier = { has_character_flag = requiem_tribunal_member_flag count >= 6 } } } } } on_accept = { scope:recipient = { save_scope_as = tribunal_candidate } scope:actor = { trigger_event = { id = requiem_prison.3000 } } } } (edited)
Pep 11/16/2025 5:27 AM
Yeah sorry about my sleep deprived addled suggestion to use a svalue there, I really need a 24 hour sleep session when these builders finish the kitchen, before they start on the bathroom in December BTW you can better format blocks of code by inserting the block between a starting and ending line that consist of just three backticks `
Pep

King Spork 11/16/2025 12:01 PM
Can somebody take a look at this code and tell me if I'm doing it right? My intent for this trigger: - If the character is an acolyte - And their prophet's culture matches the passed-in culture Then return true My code: portrait_acolyte_clothing_trigger = { has_trait = acolyte exists = { random_relation = { type = prophet this.var:adopted_cultural_style = flag:$CULTURE_FLAG$ } } } I'm not at all confident that this is right...
Agami 11/16/2025 12:03 PM
random_relation is an effect, you want a trigger, any_relation
12:04 PM
and you won't need exists in that case
12:05 PM
this will probably start throwing errors when checking the variable if it doesn't exist, so you might want to add has_variable = adopted_cultural_style before the var: check
King Spork 11/16/2025 1:13 PM
Thanks! Is there a better way to check a character's culture?
Agami 11/16/2025 1:39 PM
culture = culture:english
1
King Spork 11/16/2025 3:48 PM
portrait_acolyte_clothing_trigger = { has_trait = acolyte any_relation = { type = prophet culture = culture:$CULTURE$ } } Does that look correct?
King Spork
portrait_acolyte_clothing_trigger = { has_trait = acolyte any_relation = { type = prophet culture = culture:$CULTURE$ } } Does that look correct?
KeizerHarm | T4N 11/16/2025 3:50 PM
It looks fine, though you may want to write culture = $CULTURE$ instead. Now you could only pass the culture's key as an argument, and not for example a scope or variable containing the desired culture
Pep 11/16/2025 3:51 PM
Not sure you can because it's a clothing trigger so has to conform to the current triggers?

King Spork 11/16/2025 3:55 PM
So this is my code in gfx/portraits/portrait_modifiers ccarnde_ferrearosa_acolyte_clothes = { dna_modifiers = { accessory = { mode = add gene = clothes template = ccarnde_ferrearosa_acolyte_clothes range = { 0 1 } # For the randomness to work correctly } } outfit_tags = { ccarnde_ferrearosa_acolyte_outfit } weight = { base = 0 modifier = { add = 100 portrait_acolyte_clothing_trigger = { # This is the trigger I'm calling CULTURE = ccarnde_ferrearosa # Should I pass something different? } } } }
Canny 11/16/2025 3:57 PM
CULTURE = ccarnde_ferrearosa and not CULTURE = culture:ccarnde_ferrearosa? (edited)
Pep 11/16/2025 3:57 PM
Okay in that sense it's fine but I would name it something else then as it doesn't fit with the current clothing triggers scheme because as Keizer said, the clothing triggers look for the parameter to be part of a gfx clothing name.
King Spork 11/16/2025 3:59 PM
Do I have to hook into the vanilla triggers though? I don't understand this well, but I thought I could just make my own portrait_modifiers/triggers
Pep 11/16/2025 3:59 PM
As it's a dead end trigger, it doesn't really matter if you use culture:some_culture or some_culture and provide the culture: in the trigger tbh
King Spork
Do I have to hook into the vanilla triggers though? I don't understand this well, but I thought I could just make my own portrait_modifiers/triggers
Pep 11/16/2025 4:00 PM
You can but anyone else that reads your mod would expect something named portrait_acolyte_clothing_trigger to follow the clothing triggers scheme. It's up to you, what you have works.
King Spork 11/16/2025 4:00 PM
ah I see
Pep
As it's a dead end trigger, it doesn't really matter if you use culture:some_culture or some_culture and provide the culture: in the trigger tbh
Canny 11/16/2025 4:01 PM
My bad, didnt see culture: is already in the trigger but passing culture:something to culture:$CULTURE$ also works?
King Spork
ah I see
Pep 11/16/2025 4:02 PM
Could a character have the acolyte trait and not have a prophet relationship or a prophet relationship with someone that isn't of that culture?
King Spork 11/16/2025 4:02 PM
Acolytes must have a prophet. Prophets may or may not have acolytes. The acolyte's clothing is meant to conform to the culture of the prophet
Canny
My bad, didnt see culture: is already in the trigger but passing culture:something to culture:$CULTURE$ also works?
Pep 11/16/2025 4:03 PM
No the latter wouldn't work because then the trigger would be checking culture:culture:something So they have to be exact in the usage as always.
2
King Spork

King Spork 11/16/2025 7:31 PM
Can I put if/else statements inside iterators? every_county = { limit = { ... some filter conditions... } if = { ... some stuff } else = { ... some different stuff } } like that?
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:31 PM
Yes. It'll execute either branch of effects depending on your logic on every county within the filter. (edited)
1
King Spork 11/16/2025 7:32 PM
brilliant, thanks!
Thecat 11/16/2025 7:33 PM
Hey just wondering if there is a way for me to remove something from a global variable list whilst keeping the list itself
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:33 PM
e.g.: every_county = { limit = { this.religion = islam_religion } if = { limit = { this.faith = faith:ashari } set_county_faith = catholic } else = { set_county_faith = insular_celtic } }
1
Thecat
Hey just wondering if there is a way for me to remove something from a global variable list whilst keeping the list itself
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:33 PM
You mean if the list has A,B,C and you remove B, it'll still have A and C?
Thecat 11/16/2025 7:33 PM
yes!
7:34 PM
I messed up and added a variable to my main mod that means the world floods sometimes lol
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:34 PM
Yeah; remove_target_from_list I think is the command. (edited)
Thecat 11/16/2025 7:34 PM

King Spork 11/16/2025 7:36 PM
Do i use holder to get the character from within a county scope? every_county = { limit = { this.religion = islam_religion } holder = { set_character_faith = faith:catholic } } something like that? (edited)
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:37 PM
Yes, you can connect scopes like that.
7:37 PM
More clearly: every_county = { limit = { this.religion = islam_religion } this.holder = { set_character_faith = faith:catholic } }
1
7:37 PM
this is not necessary, but it makes for clearer code.
1
Thecat 11/16/2025 7:38 PM
Hmm its saying that remove_target_from_list is unknown
a 11/16/2025 7:38 PM
there's 2 one for local the other for global lists
Thecat
Hmm its saying that remove_target_from_list is unknown
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS 11/16/2025 7:39 PM
remove_list_global_variable is the command. Synatx is remove_list_variable = { name = X target = Y } Where X is the name of the variable Where Y is an event target https://ck3.paradoxwikis.com/Effects_list
Thecat 11/16/2025 7:39 PM
ah I see thank you!
LT-Rascek | WtWSMS
remove_list_global_variable is the command. Synatx is remove_list_variable = { name = X target = Y } Where X is the name of the variable Where Y is an event target https://ck3.paradoxwikis.com/Effects_list

Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/17/2025 6:46 AM
You can't just say islam_religion on its own, you need the prefix religion:islam_religion (edited)
6:46 AM
That tells the game to look it up specifically in the religion database

3:53 PM

3:54 PM
Here's the full effect:
3:54 PM
make_legislator_effect = { set_variable = { name = is_a_senator value = 1 } scope:situation = { add_to_variable_list = { name = legislators target = PREV } } create_character_memory = { type = elected_legislator_memory } scope:new_memory = { set_variable = { name = legislature_title value = scope:situation.var:legislature_title } set_variable = { name = riding value = scope:county } } trigger_event = { id = legislature_elections.10 } }
3:54 PM
When I start a new game, legislature_elections.10 does fire, and the character it fires for does have is_a_senator = 1
3:55 PM
However, it fires twice for the same character, which should not be possible
3:55 PM
That's because that effect fires from this one:
3:55 PM
elect_new_legislator_effect = { save_scope_as = county title_province = { faith = { save_temporary_scope_as = temp_faith } culture = { save_temporary_scope_as = temp_culture } } # Make a list of every possible candidate holder = { every_courtier = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } every_pool_guest = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } } every_county_province ?= { province_owner ?= { every_courtier = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } every_pool_guest = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } } every_province_domicile ?= { owner = { every_courtier = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } every_pool_guest = { limit = { eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = yes } add_to_temporary_list = temp_candidates } } } } # Elect the best candidate from the list ordered_in_list = { list = temp_candidates order_by = legislator_score make_legislator_effect = yes } }
3:55 PM
And you've already seen eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger:
3:56 PM
eligible_legislator_candidate_trigger = { is_adult = yes is_alive = yes is_incapable = no is_landed = no NOT = { scope:situation = { is_target_in_variable_list = { name = legislators target = PREV } } } NOT = { is_in_list = candidates } is_interested_in_politics_trigger = yes }
3:56 PM
So what is supposed to happen is that for every county, the game builds a list of eligible candidates, specifically excluding anyone who's been added to the legislator list, and then selects one to add to the legislator list

3:57 PM
initialize_starting_legislature_effect = { save_scope_as = ruler start_situation = { type = legislature save_scope_as = situation start_phase = in_session } every_held_title = { limit = { tier = prev.primary_title.tier } save_temporary_scope_as = temp_title scope:situation.situation_sub_region:legislature_title_region = { add_dejure_title_to_sub_region = scope:temp_title } clear_saved_scope = temp_title } primary_title = { save_scope_as = target_title set_variable = { name = legislature value = scope:situation } } scope:situation ?= { set_situation_center_province = scope:ruler.capital_province set_variable = { name = legislature_title value = scope:target_title } } # Elect starting legislators every_sub_realm_county ?= { elect_new_legislator_effect = yes } scope:situation ?= { every_participant_group = { every_situation_group_participant = { recalculate_participant_group = scope:situation } } } }

Pep 11/17/2025 4:23 PM
Then you somehow have a double entry in your list. Psikoota 11/17/2025 7:57 PM
does anyone know how to quickly find what is causing crash? The logs are full of small errors but it is hard to tell what is causing crash. The game loads but then crashes after clicking "custom start" looking at error.log right now I added a ton of cultural names to the landed titles file, and i can't tell what is crashing the game. I already checked using a script to confirm there are no bracket mismatches
Agami 11/17/2025 8:09 PM
no easy way
8:09 PM
!binarysearch
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/17/2025 8:09 PM
Sometimes the mod crashes and the error log doesn't help. We've all been there. If there's nothing else you can do (like solve any other reported issues, even if they may seem harmless), then you can do a binary search process. First, back up your mod somewhere. Then, select half the files or folders in the mod, and delete them. Start with systems like events, gui and localisation that are on top of the architecture rather than at its core. If you can now launch the mod, then the crash issue was located somewhere in the deleted files. If you still cannot launch it, the issue is in the undeleted half of your files. Having found the half with the problem, repeat the process for that half by deleting one quarter of the mod. Then one eighth, all the way until you can narrow it down to a single file. Then, start commenting out parts of that file until you can resolve it to one entity, and finally one line of script. This process takes some time and many launches of the game, but if nothing else makes sense, it's a good fallback method.
Psikoota 11/17/2025 8:16 PM
i got it! yeah just went one by one in the localisation errors. There was a stray = sign

print("yay") 11/17/2025 8:28 PM
Heyo! Does anyone know exactly which are the specific conditions that allow travel between two baronies (as the game calls them)? I've been trying to get travel from the westernmost ocean to easternmost ocean working like Europeans thought it did way back when they didn't know about what lied beyond. With that goal in mind, I added an entry in my mod's map_data/adjacencies.csv, to connect them. Nevertheless, when attempting to connect two disconnected sea "baronies" via another, whilst the game does highlight the connected barony and estimate travel times with the connection in mind, it does not actually permit travel. Error/debug/game logs are of no help, sadly. I'm guessing the game doesn't permit this because the "Through" barony isn't actually connected to both other baronies, and as such the engine fails to pathfind. I'd really like to avoid doing some teleport shenanigans, as that would be: 1) ugly 2) a lot of edge cases So, does someone have any idea of how the game decides what travel is actually possible? I'm having a difficult time checking whether a specific scope is in another scope's variable list. I'm doing the following: random_vassal = { limit = { highest_held_title_tier > tier_barony NOT = { # not already selected is_target_in_variable_list = { name = title:e_north_sea.high_king_elector_list target = primary_title } } } I need to check whether the current random_vassal's primary title (the target) is in the high_king_elector_list stored on title_e_north_sea, which is a variable list. Canny 11/18/2025 1:44 AM
Usually, when I use is_target_in_variable_list it is on the scope where the variable is attached to random_vassal = { limit = { highest_held_title_tier > tier_barony primary_title = { title:e_north_sea = { NOT = { is_target_in_variable_list = { name = high_king_elector_list target = prev } } } } } # effect }
Slow 11/18/2025 1:56 AM
Is there any way to scope any character within diplomatic range? I want to have a decision that will appear if anyone within diplo range has a certain artifact with xyz variable but I dont know if its possible to scope every character within diplo range
2:00 AM
is_shown = { limit = { every_living_character = { any_character_artifact = { has_variable = xyz } in_diplomatic_range = yes } } } This was my only idea that I could come up with (edited)
2:01 AM
or is_shown = { if = { limit = { every_living_character = { any_character_artifact = { has_variable = onering } in_diplomatic_range = yes } } } }
Canny 11/18/2025 3:20 AM
you dont need ifs and limits in is_shown block because it is for triggers. I'm not really one to pay atttention to performance impact but any_living_character or anything like that in a decision or character interaction would probably slow the game down especially if the decision/character_interaction is widely available. Someone who knows more might correct me though
Saltfish | Anime mods, RUI Un 11/18/2025 3:25 AM
use global list to track them. abuse any living character is very expensive

Agami 11/18/2025 9:09 AM
look up what the effect actually does in scripted effects it's in common\scripted_effects\00_culture_effects.txt it uses set_culture = scope:new_culture
9:09 AM
of course it won't convert faith
9:10 AM
there are no OLD_FAITH or NEW_FAITH parameters there
9:10 AM
read this on scripted effects https://ck3.paradoxwikis.com/Scripting#Scripted_effects
9:11 AM
these aren't some magic words, it's just predefined places for replacements

Canny 11/19/2025 8:37 AM
Either get the old version of the mod or play the supported version of the game. Basic update of mod to new game versions includes updating the vanilla files the mod replaces to the new ones. It becomes case by case after that, depending on the mod and the game update
1

the numbers are kinda dumb, they just make stuff harder to identify, and you can see Paradox also realised that because they stopped using ID numbers for dynasties and characters already in the first expansion for CK3.

Canny
noble families have county level manor titles iirc
CdQuart 11/19/2025 10:19 AM
Thanks, I've checked them out now. It seems like the key that allows them to function as an estate is the noble_family = yes part c_nf_yamato = { # YAMATO color = { 100 100 100 } capital = c_yamashiro definite_form = yes landless = yes ruler_uses_title_name = no always_follows_primary_heir = yes no_automatic_claims = yes noble_family = yes destroy_if_invalid_heir = yes ai_primary_priority = { add = @never_primary_score } } I wonder how hard would it be to use this system to make monasteries. Would it require a new form of government?

Agami
has_doctrine_parameter is a faith trigger, not a religion one and it doesn't use this syntax the triggers log says has_doctrine_parameter = parameter_key
King Spork 11/19/2025 1:00 PM
Thanks for replying, how can I fix my syntax? trigger = { faith = { has_doctrine_parameter = { prophets_are_divine = no }} } Is that better? The difference between it being set to no and not existing, is that it would exist only in religions that have Prophets (new thing I'm implementing in my mod), but I think what I should do is create a separate parameter to explicitly mark religions that have prophets, and check that instead. (edited)
King Spork
Thanks for replying, how can I fix my syntax? trigger = { faith = { has_doctrine_parameter = { prophets_are_divine = no }} } Is that better? The difference between it being set to no and not existing, is that it would exist only in religions that have Prophets (new thing I'm implementing in my mod), but I think what I should do is create a separate parameter to explicitly mark religions that have prophets, and check that instead. (edited)
Pep 11/19/2025 1:02 PM
faith = { has_doctrine_parameter = prophets_are_divine }
1
King Spork 11/19/2025 1:03 PM
@Pep Could i use faith = { has_doctrine_parameter != prophets_are_divine } to check the inverse (prophets aren't considered divine in that religion)
Pep 11/19/2025 1:03 PM
Nope, would have to be not = { has_doctrine_parameter = prophets_are_divine }
1

R
Hello. I want to ask for help regarding clothing modifier. How does it work in portrait modifier? How does the range 0 to 1 work? For example in a gene with 11 models, I want to modifier to pick one model from 7 to 9. How can I do it?
KeizerHarm | T4N 11/20/2025 2:11 AM
Assuming that's 7 to 9 inclusive, you would use range = { 0.64 0.81 }
2:12 AM
Just 7/11 and 9/11
2:12 AM
Rounding inward so you won't accidentally get the others

Hey, i want a script for a decision to transfer/create a title to the player character. Basically the debug command "give_title ID" as a decision mod script. What i came up with doesn't work tho. What am i making wrong? create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title = title:ID set_holder = ROOT } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } } (edited)
Easteregg
Hey, i want a script for a decision to transfer/create a title to the player character. Basically the debug command "give_title ID" as a decision mod script. What i came up with doesn't work tho. What am i making wrong? create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title = title:ID set_holder = ROOT } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } } (edited)
Canny 11/20/2025 5:57 AM

5:57 AM

Easteregg 11/20/2025 5:58 AM

Easteregg
Hey, i want a script for a decision to transfer/create a title to the player character. Basically the debug command "give_title ID" as a decision mod script. What i came up with doesn't work tho. What am i making wrong? create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title = title:ID set_holder = ROOT } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } } (edited)
Pep 11/20/2025 5:59 AM
Replace your create-title and set_holder with If creating a new title create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = created save_scope_as = change } title:the_title = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:who_gets_the_title change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change If transferring a existing title, just change this in the above snippet create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = granted save_scope_as = change }
Easteregg
no, a custom county tier title. title ID in that specific case is "x_c_nomad_707"
Canny 11/20/2025 6:01 AM
did you create that title? it seems like an autogenerated one
Pep
Replace your create-title and set_holder with If creating a new title create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = created save_scope_as = change } title:the_title = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:who_gets_the_title change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change If transferring a existing title, just change this in the above snippet create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = granted save_scope_as = change }
Easteregg 11/20/2025 6:02 AM
"holder = scope:who_gets_the_title" or "holder = Root"?
Easteregg
"holder = scope:who_gets_the_title" or "holder = Root"?
Pep 11/20/2025 6:02 AM
Yes
6:03 AM
Though it's typically spelled root
6:03 AM
You can ofc select other reasons for transferring the title such as revoked and usurped
Canny 11/20/2025 6:03 AM
I prefer ROOT myself XD
Pep 11/20/2025 6:03 AM
That too.
6:04 AM
But Initialised should be a no no.
6:06 AM
I tend to shy away from ROOT, AND, NOT, NOR, etc because I cba to keep shifting to caps for tokens that are used so much, plus it triggers PTSD from using archaic languages that forced Capitalization and Initialed tokens.
1
Canny 11/20/2025 6:08 AM
I find ROOT more readable than root personally but i hate it more if it isnt consistent like ROOT and then prev, either all lowercase or all uppercase for me
1
Pep 11/20/2025 6:09 AM
The only place I really agree with caps is in localization with [ROOT., [THIS. and [PREV.
1
Easteregg 11/20/2025 6:22 AM
Sadly not working. Decision appears but has no effect. To give a bit more information: I play with a mod that gives feudal (and other) governments an Estate. The Estate is said x_c_nomad_707 title of county rank. My problem is, that my former ruler abdicated and didn't pass on the title to his heir. I noticed only after the former ruler died on which the title wasn't passed on but got destroyed. I can access the title via the "Find Title" menu but can't create it, because it has no de jure counties. I managed to give the title back to my current PC via debug command (give_title x_c_nomad_707) but i would prefer to not use debug. Any ideas? That's the script right now (i tested it twice, both with "root" and with "who_gets_the_title"): create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = created save_scope_as = change } title:x_c_nomad_707 = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:root change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } }
6:23 AM
On a side note: how to insert cool code blocks in Discord chat? I look stupid D:
Easteregg
On a side note: how to insert cool code blocks in Discord chat? I look stupid D:
Pep 11/20/2025 6:24 AM
Insert a line before and after your code block that consists of only three backticks `
6:25 AM
And to insert a code block inline wrap the inline code block with a single starting and ending backtick `
Easteregg 11/20/2025 6:26 AM
like this
6:26 AM
cool
Easteregg
Sadly not working. Decision appears but has no effect. To give a bit more information: I play with a mod that gives feudal (and other) governments an Estate. The Estate is said x_c_nomad_707 title of county rank. My problem is, that my former ruler abdicated and didn't pass on the title to his heir. I noticed only after the former ruler died on which the title wasn't passed on but got destroyed. I can access the title via the "Find Title" menu but can't create it, because it has no de jure counties. I managed to give the title back to my current PC via debug command (give_title x_c_nomad_707) but i would prefer to not use debug. Any ideas? That's the script right now (i tested it twice, both with "root" and with "who_gets_the_title"): create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = created save_scope_as = change } title:x_c_nomad_707 = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:root change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } }
Canny 11/20/2025 6:26 AM
If the title already exists, you need to use the 2nd code snippet Pep provided create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = granted save_scope_as = change } title:the_title = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:who_gets_the_title change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change (edited)
Pep 11/20/2025 6:27 AM
Yeah but I'd probably use type = inherited for their use case.
6:27 AM
Always helps when someone gives the full picture

Easteregg
Sadly not working. Decision appears but has no effect. To give a bit more information: I play with a mod that gives feudal (and other) governments an Estate. The Estate is said x_c_nomad_707 title of county rank. My problem is, that my former ruler abdicated and didn't pass on the title to his heir. I noticed only after the former ruler died on which the title wasn't passed on but got destroyed. I can access the title via the "Find Title" menu but can't create it, because it has no de jure counties. I managed to give the title back to my current PC via debug command (give_title x_c_nomad_707) but i would prefer to not use debug. Any ideas? That's the script right now (i tested it twice, both with "root" and with "who_gets_the_title"): create_title_decision = { picture = { reference = "gfx/interface/illustrations/decisions/decision_smith.dds" } ai_check_interval = 60 is_shown = { is_ai = no } is_valid = { gold >= 100 } cost = { gold = 100 } effect = { create_title_and_vassal_change = { type = created save_scope_as = change } title:x_c_nomad_707 = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:root change = scope:change } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change } ai_will_do = { base = 0 } }
Miria | Runeterra 11/20/2025 6:33 AM
x_c_nomad_707 looks like a dynamically created title as Canny mentioned, and afaik those titles cannot be referenced using title:id , you would have to save the title as scope/variable then reference it that way instead of using title:ID (edited)
Pep 11/20/2025 6:34 AM
I gave players the ability to write a Last Will and Testament to grant their titles to anyone they feel like, if they can't handle a little title history angst then
Miria | Runeterra

Easteregg
So how do i save the title as variable=
Miria | Runeterra 11/20/2025 6:43 AM
when you are creating the title, you can save the title scope with save_scope_as = my_estate_title in the create title effect. then you can do set_global_variable = { name = estate_var value = scope:my_estate_title } then in the code you're using, just replace title:id with global_var:estate_var (edited)
Pep
Then no, you cannot transfer it, you'd have to create it. So again take a peek at the laamp effects.
Canny 11/20/2025 6:43 AM

1

Canny

Easteregg 11/20/2025 7:10 AM
Yeah, again, it seems to come to that
Pep 11/20/2025 7:10 AM
Because console is debug, you can do anything with a debugger but that doesn't mean the application you are debugging can do what you are doing with workarounds.
7:11 AM
In any application/system, when you debug you are bypassing all the mechanics. (edited)
Canny 11/20/2025 7:11 AM
yea, just like how there is an instantbirth for console but not for effects
1
Pep
How did you even lose it?

Vandrad 11/20/2025 9:28 AM
I'd like to create two portrait triggers similar to the ones used in vanilla to display the changing of fashion, but linked to cultural eras and innovations rather than exact dates. portrait_era1_prop_trigger = { culture = { has_cultural_era = culture_era_tribal NOR = { has_innovation = innovation_arched_saddle has_cultural_tradition = tradition_ep3_audacious_cadets } } } portrait_era2_prop_trigger = { culture = { OR = { has_innovation = innovation_arched_saddle has_cultural_tradition = tradition_ep3_audacious_cadets } } } I'm pretty sure this isn't the most elegant way to do it, and I'm afraid it might also be the wrong way. Am I missing something?
Vandrad
I'd like to create two portrait triggers similar to the ones used in vanilla to display the changing of fashion, but linked to cultural eras and innovations rather than exact dates. portrait_era1_prop_trigger = { culture = { has_cultural_era = culture_era_tribal NOR = { has_innovation = innovation_arched_saddle has_cultural_tradition = tradition_ep3_audacious_cadets } } } portrait_era2_prop_trigger = { culture = { OR = { has_innovation = innovation_arched_saddle has_cultural_tradition = tradition_ep3_audacious_cadets } } } I'm pretty sure this isn't the most elegant way to do it, and I'm afraid it might also be the wrong way. Am I missing something?
Pep 11/20/2025 9:42 AM
There's nothing inelegant about that snippet, it's about the bare minimum to do what you want. Provided the triggers run within a scope that has culture it should do what you want.
Vandrad 11/20/2025 9:48 AM
That's good to hear, ty!

Posthumous 11/20/2025 2:41 PM
Hello guys, I am trying to write a decision to randomly choose an artifact in a certain type I have (like armor) and add a modifier to it, currently I'm stuck at the part of writing is_shown requirements, how can I let the game scan if I have an armor artifact? (edited)
Posthumous
Hello guys, I am trying to write a decision to randomly choose an artifact in a certain type I have (like armor) and add a modifier to it, currently I'm stuck at the part of writing is_shown requirements, how can I let the game scan if I have an armor artifact? (edited)
Immortal_Hybrid - CK3AGOT, LOTR 11/20/2025 2:43 PM
any_character_artifact = { artifact_slot_type = armor }
Posthumous 11/20/2025 2:43 PM
can i not scan the slot_type?
Immortal_Hybrid - CK3AGOT, LOTR 11/20/2025 2:43 PM
So the first part is checking through your whole inventory for artifacts
2:43 PM
The second checks for specific slots
Posthumous 11/20/2025 2:44 PM
Will this work? any_character_artifact = { artifact_type = xyz }
Immortal_Hybrid - CK3AGOT, LOTR 11/20/2025 2:44 PM
If you don't want to scan the slot then artifact_type = armor_plate should work
2:45 PM
Not sure if there are other armour types though, which is why I used the slot
2:45 PM
If there are multiple and you choose to check them, make sure to use an OR
Posthumous 11/20/2025 2:49 PM
no this is not working, no idea why
2:50 PM
is_shown= { any_character_artifact = { artifact_type = xyz } } effect = { random_equipped_character_artifact = { limit = { artifact_type = xyz } save_scope_as = artifact } scope:artifact = { add_artifact_modifier = artifact_monthly_lifestyle_xp_1_modifier }} (edited)
2:56 PM
thanks anyway, will try later

FizCap 11/22/2025 6:19 AM
I have a question about character_interaction_categories, is there a way to make it compatiable between 2 mods if they use the same index number without having to manually change the index number to a higher value?
FizCap
I have a question about character_interaction_categories, is there a way to make it compatiable between 2 mods if they use the same index number without having to manually change the index number to a higher value?
Pep 11/22/2025 6:21 AM
Nope, the whole character interaction category index mechanism is horrid for mod compatibility. You can't even send your to the roof just in case some other mod might clash because you can't leave holes in the index, only a compatch can solve the problem.
Pep
Nope, the whole character interaction category index mechanism is horrid for mod compatibility. You can't even send your to the roof just in case some other mod might clash because you can't leave holes in the index, only a compatch can solve the problem.
FizCap 11/22/2025 6:21 AM
damn what a pain in the ass lol
Pep 11/22/2025 6:21 AM
Yep but Paradox don't have to worry about that, so they don't.
FizCap 11/22/2025 6:23 AM
guess ill just release a lite mode game rule that disables the custom category i made for those who want it (edited)
FizCap
guess ill just release a lite mode game rule that disables the custom category i made for those who want it (edited)

Noctem 11/22/2025 6:33 AM
Hey all, I want to give DNA to King Louis VII of France and his son Philippe. Is it possible to do so without copying over the entire french character history file? I've tried otherwise and all it's led to is either every other french character disapearing or the family tree showing double
Canny
check the error logs for associated errors
Sam M 11/22/2025 7:23 AM
What does 'unexpected token' mean?
7:24 AM

Sam M
What does 'unexpected token' mean?
Canny 11/22/2025 7:24 AM
usually syntax error, a command the game doesnt recognize, etc.
Sam M 11/22/2025 7:24 AM
okay. I copied it from the vanilla university visit event, so I don't know what's wrong
Canny 11/22/2025 7:25 AM
Just check the ones referenced related to your code. It also usually tells you where in the file the error begins by line number
Noctem
Hey all, I want to give DNA to King Louis VII of France and his son Philippe. Is it possible to do so without copying over the entire french character history file? I've tried otherwise and all it's led to is either every other french character disapearing or the family tree showing double
Pep 11/22/2025 7:40 AM
Technically no. Any changes to history involve copying the complete file. If you try to copy just a single character you will end up with duplicate characters in the tree. However there are a couple of workarounds. The first and easiest one is to create a new historic character in a new file that died somewhere in the past and put the dna on them, then in a custom on_game_start_after_lobby use copy_inheritable_appearance_from to copy the dna from the donor corpse to King Louis. The other way isn't even worth considering. (edited)
Noctem
Hey all, I want to give DNA to King Louis VII of France and his son Philippe. Is it possible to do so without copying over the entire french character history file? I've tried otherwise and all it's led to is either every other french character disapearing or the family tree showing double
Canny 11/22/2025 7:41 AM
copy_inheritable_appearance_from is mostly for inheritance dna iirc, it doesnt copy exact appearance
Pep 11/22/2025 7:42 AM
I use it a lot and have only ever seen expected results
Canny 11/22/2025 7:43 AM
It copies exactly? huh, guess I misremembered
Sam M
okay. I copied it from the vanilla university visit event, so I don't know what's wrong
Pep 11/22/2025 7:44 AM
Largely depends on what you copy from where to where, not everything that is valid in one place is valid everywhere else. Trying to import a localization key outside of a language implies a context issue. Maybe you have an unclosed { Always best to show us the related script rather than just snippets of error messages with a brief description of what you did.

Sam M
