Pep 11/22/2025 7:54 AM
Then use else_if
7:54 AM
else is a last ditch default.
7:56 AM
A limit on a else does seem to work but it indicates both a broken parser and broken script. The latter you can fix yourself and if Paradox fix the former your mod will break, so you'd have to fix it then. (edited)

Pep 11/22/2025 4:34 PM
You can't just overwrite vanilla on_actions because you clobber the vanilla content and cause a duplicate effect/trigger error. Instead you have to extend the vanilla on_action by appending your custom on_action in a new file. So like this on_action_after_lobby = { on_actions = my_on_action_after_lobby } my_on_action_after_lobby = { # place your original my_on_action_after_lobby trigger/effect/events, etc here }
King Spork

ceezdee 11/23/2025 1:41 PM
hey im trying to make a custom CB where the attacker loses land if they lose but ive been having trouble with it. the file is kinda a mess bc i just kept adding stuff hoping something would work. rn in the war overview it says that the defender will take the title but it doesnt actually happen
1:42 PM
on_defeat = { title:c_thomond = { change_title_holder = { holder = scope:defender take_baronies = yes } } title:c_thomond = { change_title_holder = { holder = 906 take_baronies = yes } } scope:attacker = { show_pow_release_message_effect = yes } # Legitimacy add_legitimacy_attacker_defeat_effect = yes #EP2 accolade glory gain for winning against higher ranked enemy scope:defender = { accolade_defender_war_end_glory_gain_high_effect = yes } # Award the appropriate amount of prestige to all participants in the war. setup_claim_cb = { titles = target_titles attacker = scope:attacker defender = scope:defender claimant = scope:claimant victory = no } (edited)
1:42 PM
modify_all_participants_fame_values = { WINNER = scope:defender LOSER = scope:attacker FAME_BASE = scope:cb_prestige_factor # Set by 'setup_claim_cb' IS_RELIGIOUS_WAR = no WINNER_FAME_SCALE = scale_10_war_defender_win LOSER_FAME_SCALE = -10 WINNER_ALLY_FAME_SCALE = 10 LOSER_ALLY_FAME_SCALE = 10 } # Truce add_truce_attacker_defeat_effect = yes scope:attacker = { save_temporary_scope_as = loser } title:c_thomond = { add_to_temporary_list = defenders_winnings change_title_holder = { holder = scope:defender take_baronies = yes } } every_in_list = { list = defenders_winnings change_title_holder = { holder = scope:defender change = scope:change take_baronies = yes } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change scope:attacker = { resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change } scope:defender = { if = { limit = { is_ai = yes } set_realm_capital = title:c_thomond } } on_lost_aggression_war_discontent_loss = yes set_global_variable = norman_conquest_cb_concluded # EP3: note gold gained from military assistance/join war contracts and their war contribution threshold laamp_as_mercenary_payout_tooltip_effect = yes } (edited)

Pep 11/23/2025 1:50 PM
None of that makes sense. You can't resolve_title_and_vassal_change twice, it is a one off action that consumes scope:change

Canny 11/23/2025 1:53 PM
title:c_thomond = { add_to_temporary_list = titles_taken } every_in_list = { list = titles_taken change_title_holder = { holder = scope:defender change = scope:change take_baronies = yes } } resolve_title_and_vassal_change = scope:change try this, if it doesnt work, check error logs (edited)
ceezdee 11/23/2025 1:53 PM
alr thank you
Pep
Really, you sure there isn't a missing if or something that spearates them into two different logic paths?
ceezdee 11/23/2025 1:53 PM

Pep 11/23/2025 1:57 PM
By normandy invasion you mean the Norman conquest of England norman_conquest_cb?
1:57 PM
If so I can guarantee you, having just read it that it does not have those resolve_title_and_vassal_change like that.
ceezdee 11/23/2025 1:58 PM
oh then idk where th i got that from
Pep 11/23/2025 2:00 PM
The whole point of the create_title_and_vassal_change and resolve_title_and_vassal_change mechanism is that you can do countless operations such as changing title holder, or changing liege, etc in the scope:change and then finalise them all with resolve_title_and_vassal_change which processes and consumes every action in scope:change in one single commit.
ceezdee 11/23/2025 2:01 PM
ohh okay
ceezdee 11/23/2025 2:09 PM
alr its working now thank you guys

Canny 11/23/2025 2:10 PM
the code I sent was specifically for c_thomond so you might wanna change that unless its a very specific cb

Got me a ton too (edited)
toykisser
I didn't think to put "l_english" in my loc file names, I'll try that
Pep 11/23/2025 4:03 PM
Rules for loc files 1) Must be in a recognised language folder in localization/ for example localization/english/ 2) filename must end with _l_ followed by the name of the folder it is in and a .yml suffix, for example a file in localization/english/ would be localization/english/a_file_l_english.yml 3) the first line in the file must be the l_<langauge> portion of it's filename followed by a :, for example the first line in localization/english/a_file_l_english.yml would be l_english: 3.1) Nothing else should appear on the first line of a localization file. 4) in all cases _l_ is lowercase L 5) localization files must be utf-8 bom encoded 6) weirdly it is better for loading performance if your loc keys are indented by one space, though not the first line in the file. 7) You do not need to follow the deprecated Paradox standard of using :0 notation after your loc keys, it was only ever a Paradox internal notation for version control which they no longer use and served no purpose for modders (edited)
Canny 11/23/2025 4:04 PM
also, need replace folder when overwriting vanilla locs
1
Pep
Rules for loc files 1) Must be in a recognised language folder in localization/ for example localization/english/ 2) filename must end with _l_ followed by the name of the folder it is in and a .yml suffix, for example a file in localization/english/ would be localization/english/a_file_l_english.yml 3) the first line in the file must be the l_<langauge> portion of it's filename followed by a :, for example the first line in localization/english/a_file_l_english.yml would be l_english: 3.1) Nothing else should appear on the first line of a localization file. 4) in all cases _l_ is lowercase L 5) localization files must be utf-8 bom encoded 6) weirdly it is better for loading performance if your loc keys are indented by one space, though not the first line in the file. 7) You do not need to follow the deprecated Paradox standard of using :0 notation after your loc keys, it was only ever a Paradox internal notation for version control which they no longer use and served no purpose for modders (edited)

Revan 11/23/2025 5:44 PM
I have a code snippet that should make the scoped target a courtier of the root character, but the option makes them a courtier of a random ruler instead. Is there something wrong with my code? option = {#Recruit them to your camp/court name = brand_outcome.0001.recruit scope:target = { depose = yes set_character_faith_with_conversion = faith:faith_bright_lord } add_courtier = $TARGET$ }
Revan
I have a code snippet that should make the scoped target a courtier of the root character, but the option makes them a courtier of a random ruler instead. Is there something wrong with my code? option = {#Recruit them to your camp/court name = brand_outcome.0001.recruit scope:target = { depose = yes set_character_faith_with_conversion = faith:faith_bright_lord } add_courtier = $TARGET$ }
Pep 11/23/2025 5:50 PM
What's $TARGET$?
Revan 11/23/2025 5:52 PM
Is that not a reference to the scoped target?
a 11/23/2025 5:53 PM
that is not scope:target
5:53 PM
$whatever$ is a substitution that you don't see outside of scripted effects
Revan
Is that not a reference to the scoped target?
Pep 11/23/2025 5:56 PM
I mean you use scope:target above, so why try to use a effect/trigger parameter substitution which does not work in events afaik outside of local event scripted_trigger or scripted_effect? (edited)
Pep
I mean you use scope:target above, so why try to use a effect/trigger parameter substitution which does not work in events afaik outside of local event scripted_trigger or scripted_effect? (edited)
Revan 11/23/2025 6:03 PM
I had tried add_courtier, and it didn't work, so I was copying something from vanilla without fully understanding how it worked
Pep 11/23/2025 6:04 PM
ahh
6:05 PM
The correct syntax would be add_courtier = scope:target
6:05 PM
Then check your error log if it doesn't work. (edited)
Revan 11/23/2025 6:20 PM
I tried scope:root = { add_courtier = scope:target } but in the error log, it says root is undefined. This doesn't make sense, since the event pulls the "root" character for the left_portrait
Whizzer 11/23/2025 6:26 PM
scope:root is always wrong, even when it is right.
2
6:27 PM
It's just root.
Revan
I tried scope:root = { add_courtier = scope:target } but in the error log, it says root is undefined. This doesn't make sense, since the event pulls the "root" character for the left_portrait
Pep 11/23/2025 6:37 PM
Always look for the subtle differences when you get errors like that, the vanilla event is using left_portrait = { character = root } You can't just make up your own stuff

Hey y‚Äôall. Would any of you be able to point me in the right direction for changing the naming convention of Japanese cultures to house name first, forename second, instead of dynasty name first, forename second? I‚Äôve already done the work and made the changes I needed in the character_l_english.yml file in the localization folder of the base game directory so that it works for me. However, if I wanted to turn this into a mod so it‚Äôs not just me editing the main game files, how would I go about that? Do I just make a copy of the .yml file to replace the base game one, package it into its own standalone localization folder, and upload it? For example: JapaneseHouseNamingConvention.zip > localization > english > character_l_english.yml? Would that cause any strange incompatibilities or other issues? Should I also keep all the other localization stuff in that file? I've uploaded a video reference as I'm trying to avoid confusion lol. The highlighted areas are the parts of that file I edited. (edited)

oh, dont put effects on a trigger
Canny
oh, dont put effects on a trigger
ÁÉàÂ≠ê íãß 11/24/2025 3:55 AM
so, change the temp scope to be outside the trigger?
Canny 11/24/2025 3:56 AM
Yes, put it in an effect block. Put it this way, saving scopes are commands and you can't put commands in trigger blocks like limit
a 11/24/2025 3:56 AM
trigger_if doesn't fix any issues you'll still have unset scopes if there's no counties with that culture or faith to fetch
3:57 AM
you need to make sure whatever outer layer checks that before you assume there's at least valid county to calculate

4:40 AM

ÁÉàÂ≠ê íãß

Canny 11/24/2025 4:46 AM
we dont even know if scope:culture points to anything at this point. I suggest you look at the ck3 modding wiki for the basics if you wanna learn.
4:48 AM
Most blocks are either triggers or effect, the limit in if-else blocks is a trigger for example, so is the trigger block on events. You can't put commands there like adding gold or saving scopes.
4:51 AM
is this an event?
a 11/24/2025 4:51 AM
it's all inside a scripted value apparently
4:52 AM
as an override to culture_acceptance_baseline according to the posted log
4:53 AM
however it should be starting_culture_acceptance (according to the modded filename, which says it's a starting value) where you'd take the output from the previous vanilla value untouched, and then add another layer of calculation

Pep 11/24/2025 6:18 AM
Move # Set up some scopes we'll need scope:culture = { trigger_if = { limit = { culture_number_of_counties > 0 } calc_culture_dominant_religion = { save_temporary_scope_as = our_religion } calc_culture_dominant_faith = { save_temporary_scope_as = our_faith } } } trigger_if = { limit = { culture_number_of_counties > 0 } calc_culture_dominant_religion = { save_temporary_scope_as = their_religion } calc_culture_dominant_faith = { save_temporary_scope_as = their_faith } } outside of the limit to the line before # Increase base acceptance for sharing the same heritage Rewritten like this scope:culture = { if = { limit = { culture_number_of_counties > 0 } calc_culture_dominant_religion = { save_temporary_scope_as = our_religion } calc_culture_dominant_faith = { save_temporary_scope_as = our_faith } } } if = { limit = { culture_number_of_counties > 0 } calc_culture_dominant_religion = { save_temporary_scope_as = their_religion } calc_culture_dominant_faith = { save_temporary_scope_as = their_faith } } I'm assuming scope:culture exists at this point, if not add a test in the outer if's limit
ÁÉàÂ≠ê íãß 11/24/2025 6:20 AM
I'm assuming scope:culture exists at this point, if not add a test in the outer if's limit
aside from a comment saying that scope:culture = culture 2, it doesnt seem like scope:culture is said anywhere
Pep 11/24/2025 6:21 AM
As always, testing will reveal any remaining issues.
6:23 AM
Also I haven't read the rest of the svalue or any associated localization, so if there is a later reliance on those new scopes you may have to rethink your approach because you are conditionally setting them up, so there may be cases where they don't get saved. (edited)
ÁÉàÂ≠ê íãß 11/24/2025 6:24 AM
i see
6:24 AM
so because i am moving it out of the trigger, that may mean that other stuff may not work, got it (edited)
Pep 11/24/2025 6:25 AM
No, because you are setting them up conditionally based on culture_number_of_counties > 0
ÁÉàÂ≠ê íãß 11/24/2025 6:27 AM
so, if a culture has 0 counties, then stuff may break?
Pep 11/24/2025 6:27 AM
Yes because then you don't save the scopes.

King Spork 11/24/2025 4:23 PM
What does trigger_if do? I'm a bit confused about this. In a given trigger you'll see a bunch of conditions, then sometimes among those conditions you'll see a trigger_if block with it's own set of conditions, and sometimes a nested trigger_if. Can someone help clear it up for me please?
Whizzer 11/24/2025 4:24 PM
It's the trigger equivalent of if, so only if its limit evaluates to true will its content triggers be evaluated.
4:25 PM
Otherwise, it's simply ignored.
King Spork 11/24/2025 4:27 PM
@Whizzer why is that useful, vs just putting the conditions inside trigger_if at the top level? Is it to avoid errors if a scope doesn't exist or something?
Whizzer 11/24/2025 4:28 PM
If you want some requirement to only apply to characters of a certain culture or faith, trigger_if is the way to go. (edited)
4:28 PM
And you could indeed check if something exists before checking things for that thing, but other things exist for that, like ?=.
King Spork 11/24/2025 4:33 PM
I get it. Thanks!
King Spork
@Whizzer why is that useful, vs just putting the conditions inside trigger_if at the top level? Is it to avoid errors if a scope doesn't exist or something?
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/24/2025 5:18 PM
Tooltipping. If the limit for the trigger_if fails then the requirement is hidden.
5:19 PM
So instead of the tooltip saying "Not all of the below: Is catholic and gluttonous" it will only show "Is not gluttonous" if you happen to be catholic, for example.
1
King Spork 11/24/2025 6:23 PM
I'm trying to debug portrait modifier triggers, specifically this line in portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger limit = { exists = top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style } Will debug_log = "Adopted style is: [top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style]" work to check that value? Or is my syntax wrong?
King Spork
I'm trying to debug portrait modifier triggers, specifically this line in portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger limit = { exists = top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style } Will debug_log = "Adopted style is: [top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style]" work to check that value? Or is my syntax wrong?
Pep 11/24/2025 6:53 PM
Your syntax is wrong but more importantly, you cannot use debug_log like that in triggers, you can only do debug_log = yes which will be true or false depending on if the parent trigger succeeded or failed. my_trigger = { is_adult = yes is_male = yes is_ruler = yes debug_log = yes } Will show true if my_trigger is true, otherwise false. Also debug_log_details does the same but in addition will also show which of the inner triggers succeeded/failed.
1
King Spork 11/24/2025 7:12 PM
Got it, thanks

Pep 11/25/2025 4:30 AM

4:31 AM

I'm trying to copy the pattern in the vanilla files. But it seems like there's a puzzle piece missing. For example I search the clothes modifiers for "byzantine" to see how it's done for the byzantine culture. These are the only functions I can find: portrait_byzantine_clothing_trigger = { portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger = { CULTURE_SCOPE = scope:culture CULTURE_FLAG = byzantine } } portrait_byzantine_clothing_spouse_trigger = { portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger = { CULTURE_SCOPE = culture CULTURE_FLAG = byzantine } } And all the cultures are basically like this... the only culture-specific triggers seem to just be passing a CULTURE_SCOPE and CULTURE_FLAG value to portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger which then does some tests on the culture.
King Spork
I'm trying to copy the pattern in the vanilla files. But it seems like there's a puzzle piece missing. For example I search the clothes modifiers for "byzantine" to see how it's done for the byzantine culture. These are the only functions I can find: portrait_byzantine_clothing_trigger = { portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger = { CULTURE_SCOPE = scope:culture CULTURE_FLAG = byzantine } } portrait_byzantine_clothing_spouse_trigger = { portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger = { CULTURE_SCOPE = culture CULTURE_FLAG = byzantine } } And all the cultures are basically like this... the only culture-specific triggers seem to just be passing a CULTURE_SCOPE and CULTURE_FLAG value to portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger which then does some tests on the culture.
Pep 11/25/2025 12:44 PM
But that is the whole point of those triggers, they are the first level of the API The next level tests the culture. Assuming portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger is true then the modifier is applied. The actual answer to portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger lies in adopted culture of the character or their liege if it exists otherwise the culture's clothing_gfx
King Spork 11/25/2025 12:46 PM
Right... so i try to see where this var gets set: top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style But when I search for it outside of those triggers, I don't see it anywhere So it's hard to debug why the trigger I added for my custom culture isn't working
King Spork
Right... so i try to see where this var gets set: top_liege.var:adopted_cultural_style But when I search for it outside of those triggers, I don't see it anywhere So it's hard to debug why the trigger I added for my custom culture isn't working
Pep 11/25/2025 12:47 PM
Then you need to up your search skills. bp2_yearly.6070
King Spork 11/25/2025 12:48 PM
fair.
12:48 PM
thanks for that
Pep 11/25/2025 12:50 PM
The adopted culture will rarely play a part, it is dependent on that random event triggering and the option inside it being selected. I'd say 99% of the time the answer to portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger will be the culture's clothing_gfx
1
12:50 PM
Unless ofc another mod injects itself into portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger then it's anyone's guess.
12:52 PM
And then you have to remember that the modifiers themselves have a part to play in the order they are applied. If a culture has clothing_gfx = { one two three four } then it means there are at least four possible answers to portrait_shared_clothing_contents_trigger, so whichever modifier gets it's answer first will be applied, also dependent on weight iirc (edited)
1

ValiKanar 11/26/2025 4:50 AM
hey i try to make my own trait.. now i want that my trait can build rly fast.. so i do it with events.. namespace = kanar # Globaler Event (root = none) kanar.100 = { type = empty hidden = yes immediate = { every_living_character = { limit = { has_trait = blood_of_kanar } trigger_event = { id = kanar.101 } } } } # Charakter-Event (root = character) kanar.101 = { type = character_event hidden = yes immediate = { add_character_modifier = { modifier = blood_of_kanar_fast_building days = -1 } } } but the error log say [10:46:07][E][event.cpp:209]: 'empty' is not a valid entry at file: events/blood_of_kanar_event.txt line: 5 (kanar.100) (valid: character_event, court_event, activity_event, letter_event ) but the wiki says "type The kind of event. It determines what sort of scope the root is. character_event letter_event duel_event none (when an event doesn't use the root scope at all) empty (necessary for characterless events to trigger. NOTE: this means typing type = empty )" so what is wrong?
Pep 11/26/2025 4:53 AM
.info files are not always accurate, just use type = none or type = character_event Also you don't need to call a second event, you can just do what you do in the second event in the first event instead of calling the second event. (edited)
1

thanks i will try it
Pep 11/26/2025 4:58 AM
tbh I just don't specify type at all if I'm doing a hidden event.

Pep 11/26/2025 5:29 AM
It's a cursed way of specifying you have no scope, yet another ill thought out concept. So by the type default you are saying this is a character event but then by scope you are saying it has no scope, so it is effectively a scopeless character event, which makes absolutely no sense. (edited)
ValiKanar
when i type scope = none.. vs studio says again its wrong xD
Pep 11/26/2025 5:30 AM
Because you are using CWTools which is broken. Listen to the game error.log not CWTools.

Pep 11/26/2025 7:26 AM
Set inheritance on the trait so your children get it. Then look in probably gfx/portraits/trait_portrait_modifiers/ to see how traits modify a character appearance. The path might be slightly different but it will be something very similar if it's not correct.

Jaco_Daan | LotR Realms 11/26/2025 12:13 PM
Somewhat of a niche question. For character_groups (used to group character roles together, for the court), would anyone know if it being defined as follows (which is the same used by vanilla for event_group (aka, random events, typically with 3 courtiers in a triangle gossiping): lotr_orc_succession_duel = { } I then have each of my character_roles defined as follows (of which I have 7 in total): lotr_orc_heir = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel scripted_animation = { triggered_animation = { trigger = { always = yes } animation = { celebrate_axe celebrate_mace celebrate_sword celebrate_spear celebrate_hammer celebrate_longaxe } } } } None of the above throws any errors, however using the following code: court_scene = { button_position_character = scope:character_a court_event_force_open = yes show_timeout_info = no should_pause_time = yes roles = { # First, we take each scoped relevant scoped character. scope:character_a = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel } scope:character_b = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel } scope:character_c = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel } scope:character_d = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel } scope:character_e = { group = lotr_orc_succession_duel } } }
12:13 PM
with the immediate block looking as follows: immediate = { # As with portraits, we do our general character setup stuff in this event. random_courtier_or_guest = { save_scope_as = character_a } random_courtier_or_guest = { limit = { this != scope:character_a } save_scope_as = character_b } random_courtier_or_guest = { limit = { this != scope:character_a this != scope:character_b } save_scope_as = character_c } random_courtier_or_guest = { limit = { this != scope:character_a this != scope:character_b this != scope:character_c } save_scope_as = character_d } random_courtier_or_guest = { limit = { this != scope:character_a this != scope:character_b this != scope:character_c this != scope:character_d } save_scope_as = character_e } } only one orc is actually placed. Changing the group = lotr_succession_duel to something like event_group (a vanilla defined group) makes the character that are saved show up, though obviously in the wrong positions (as its randomly selecting a character_role to place them at). Keeping it as defined as above (aka, using group = lotr_orc_succession_duel for all 5 character scopes only results in one character being shown at any one
12:17 PM
Hmm... interesting... Firing the event multiple times, without resolving the event makes the characters show up. So if a trigger the same event 2 times, 2 characters show up, ditto with triggering it 3 times and having 3 characters show up, etc.

Pep 11/26/2025 1:05 PM
That does sound weird, I only played with them once when I was debugging a vanilla event and I copied a vanilla one as a template that used the petitioners group with no problems. I don't recall doing anything special but the petitioners group uses dynamic positioning, though I don't see why the event_group wouldn't work as it's used so much. One thing I would suggest though, if you can, do your character setup in a hidden lead event where you can check they all exist before calling the actual court event because there is no trigger on the court scene and if one of the characters is missing it spams the crap out of the error log because it checks and throws an error on every tick the court window is open, even if you do nothing and just stare at the empty scene. You'd think that your checks in the court scene event immediate would handle that right? But there's a nasty vanilla event with the horse master that proves that isn't the case. I requested they add a trigger to the court scene similar to portraits a while back but AUH has come along and nada

Pep 11/26/2025 6:36 PM

Saturnvoid
how do i create a new religious doctrine?
kcajkcaj | AGoT 11/26/2025 7:17 PM
Create a file in common/religion/doctrines You can look at existing files for examples, or in _doctrines.info for an explanation. If you mean adding an option to an existing doctrine_group, you will have to override the entire category. You can do it as a file override (make a copy of the file), or an entry override (make a copy of the entire doctrine_group, with a name later alphabetically than the original file)

Rust-Clad King 11/27/2025 7:27 AM
I feel like a modlist that was working perfectly well has now gone down the shitter and I have no idea what mod caused it. I assume something updated and I can't find it. How do I access debug logs? (edited)
Pep 11/27/2025 7:27 AM
!logs
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/27/2025 7:27 AM
https://yagpdb.xyz/public/735413460439007241/log/77
YAGPDB
Yet Another General Purpose Discord Bot
Pep 11/27/2025 7:27 AM
!faq
YAGPDB.xyz BOT 11/27/2025 7:27 AM
FAQ:
  • Your error.log is located in your logs folder:
    • Documents/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs on Windows
    • "$HOME/.local/share/Paradox Interactive/Crusader Kings III/logs" on Linux
  • Use the script_docs console command to dump a list of files relating to effects, triggers, event targets, etc - your standard fare for regular script. The files can be found in the same logs folder.
  • Use the dump_data_types console command to dump a list of all datatypes and data functions available and their return types - all of them used for GUI modding and advanced localisation. The dumped lists can be found in - you guessed it - the logs folder! Under logs/data_types/ specifically.
  • Most files need to be in the UTF8-BOM encoding.
  • Your localization files need to have names that end in _l_english.yml and their contents have to start with l_english: at the start of each file.
  • Scopes are objects (class instances) while scope types are classes.
  • Scope is also a verb which means to change scopes for a particular piece of script, i.e. scope to father by doing father = {
  • Use triple backticks (`) around your code in order to show it properly on Discord.
  • Use Visual Studio Code with the CWTools and Paradox Syntax Highlighting plugins.
  • Use screenshots, with Win+shift+S on Windows. Please don't take photos of your screen with your phone, it makes us all die inside.
  • For the full list of commands this bot has to offer, use !botcommands.
Rust-Clad King 11/27/2025 7:28 AM
appreciated
Pep 11/27/2025 7:28 AM
debug log is in the same location as the error log

ShalolaAuthor 11/27/2025 12:06 PM
whats the difference between these 2: # Everyone sorted into the list 'characters' has # the potential of being shown to be selected. # # Uses the scopes actor, recipient, # secondary_actor and secondary_recipient. populate_actor_list = {} # Same as populate_actor_list populate_recipient_list = {}
ShalolaAuthor
whats the difference between these 2: # Everyone sorted into the list 'characters' has # the potential of being shown to be selected. # # Uses the scopes actor, recipient, # secondary_actor and secondary_recipient. populate_actor_list = {} # Same as populate_actor_list populate_recipient_list = {}
Pep 11/27/2025 12:09 PM
Used for character selection lists in interactions like arrange marriage populate_actor_list is the list on the left that scope:actor chooses from and will become secondary_actor populate_recipient_list is the list on the right that scope:recipient chooses from and will become secondary_recipient (edited)
1
ShalolaAuthor 11/27/2025 12:09 PM
thanks pep
12:11 PM

SpitefulRaven 11/27/2025 1:26 PM
@Pep got some time to discuss my problem with cultures?
Rust-Clad King

CaptainSlapster 11/27/2025 6:24 PM

SpitefulRaven
@Pep got some time to discuss my problem with cultures?
Pep 11/27/2025 7:08 PM
I don't really create cultures so probably wouldn't be much help and I'm in the middle of a complicated debug session atm. But if your error spam for as yet uncreated cultures is while building tooltip/description That's Paradox's inability to control their tooltipping system with as yet future creations while building tooltips. Basically the engine is trying to tell the player what is happening in a effect chain but it can't tell that a particular object will be created in the effect, so it's shits the bed when it tries to document every object in the effect chain. So your options are using a band aid pdox gave us for effects, which is to wrap the bugging portion of the effect chain in hidden_effect_new_object which like hidden_effect will hide what's going on completely from the player, which is not ideal if you actually want them to know, so you have to dig deep in the effect chain to find the specific part that is bugging and hide just that part. It is a very tedious process, more so if you are dealing with a large mod. Your other option for bugging triggers is to wrap the offending part of your script with a check that the object exists. So if some variable might not exist yet while evaluating a trigger then test it exists first, which utilises the early fail nature of triggers to prevent the tooltipping system from documenting it. For example if = { limit = { is_landed = yes is_male = yes has_variable = some_variable_that_may_not_exist # early fail var:some_variable_that_may_not_exist = flag:causes_tooltipping_error } # tooltipping spam solved } (edited)
SpitefulRaven 11/27/2025 7:16 PM
basically im doing a check for existing cultures to add this trait to and it is wigging out if i choose say 867 AD since certain ones dont exist yet. I think i figured out most of it by making it genetic i can avoid a lot of it
7:17 PM
I do my inital seed and 5 year seed and avoid most of it as long as I seed the original cultures, I wish there was a derivative based flag I could add to say if they decended from these cultures add this trait to.
1
Pep 11/27/2025 7:19 PM
You need to talk to someone who creates a lot of cultures.

a 11/27/2025 9:42 PM
any_directly_owned_province = { has_holding_type = whatever }
Galle 11/28/2025 4:26 AM
How exactly does one end an activity?
4:27 AM
The wiki describes a "complete_activity" effect, but that seems to be deprecated
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/28/2025 4:39 AM
The scriptside control of activities is mostly gone
4:39 AM
You have to use the UI
KeizerHarm | T4N 11/28/2025 4:41 AM
You can make the phase end early
4:41 AM
And if it's the final phase the activity will end too
4:41 AM
But if you're thinking of a condition that should cancel the activity without disbursing any rewards then you should add it to the should_invalidate block

KeizerHarm | T4N 11/29/2025 5:36 AM
It's localisation so it's gui script
5:37 AM
Yes, here's how you get a script value in loc
5:37 AM
[GuiScope.SetRoot(GetPlayer.MakeScope).ScriptValue('alin_no_of_candidates')|V0]
5:37 AM
So for you that would be [GuiScope.SetRoot(activity.MakeScope.Var('legislature')).ScriptValue('simple_majority')|0] (edited)
Galle 11/29/2025 5:38 AM
That returns an error.

KeizerHarm | T4N 11/29/2025 5:51 AM
Here we go, found an example [GuiScope.AddScope('ability', Scope.Story.MakeScope).AddScope('bender', Character.MakeScope).ScriptValue('bending_ability_learning_impact')|V0] (edited)
5:52 AM
bending_ability_learning_impact is a script value. It uses the scopes scope:ability and scope:bender. This is the way to get its value in loc (edited)
KeizerHarm | T4N
bending_ability_learning_impact is a script value. It uses the scopes scope:ability and scope:bender. This is the way to get its value in loc (edited)
Pep 11/29/2025 5:53 AM
That is very interesting, thanks, I feel a diversion in my current development as I dive down this rabbit hole for a while, this needs to be explored
KeizerHarm | T4N 11/29/2025 5:53 AM
Also see the Scope.Story.MakeScope; the casting and uncasting necessary because just putting Scope there, the game won't accept (edited)
5:54 AM
Join us, in the gui modding coven
1
Pep 11/29/2025 5:55 AM

Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/29/2025 6:54 AM
It's pretty common
ShalolaAuthor 11/29/2025 6:54 AM
start_scheme - Starts a new scheme of the given type. usage: <scheme starting character> = start_scheme = { type = X contract = (Optional) CONTRACT target_character = (*) CHARACTER target_title = (*)TITLE target_culture = (*)CULTURE target_faith = (*)FAITH targets_nothing = (*) yes/no (default no) save_scope_as = (Optional) NAME <----- } } (*) Only one target can be specified (or 0 if target_nothing = yes). Supported Scopes: character is it really possible to do that now? i dont see any vanilla example using save_scope_as inside a start scheme the begin_scheme effect use this convoluted method to store the scope begin_scheme_basic_effect = { # Log our scheme launcher so that we can refer to them down the line. save_scope_as = scheme_launcher # Log all the currently on-going schemes. ## We do it this way being we can't guarantee mutually exclusive targets with non-character scheme targets any more: we can't just look for "X's murder scheme against Y", because X might be plotting against no target whatsoever and have multiple schemes of that type against nothing. every_scheme = { add_to_list = current_schemes_list } # Now start the scheme. start_scheme = { type = $SCHEME_TYPE$ $TARGET_TYPE$ = $TARGET_SCOPE$ } # And grab the scheme's scope. random_scheme = { limit = { NOT = { is_in_list = current_schemes_list } } save_scope_as = new_scheme } scope:new_scheme ?= { # If we have a custom charge threshold to complete, set that here. ## Sway. if = { limit = { scheme_type = sway } set_variable = { name = custom_charge_threshold value = 5 } } } }
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/29/2025 6:54 AM
That's usually how you build your own dynamic tooltips
ShalolaAuthor
start_scheme - Starts a new scheme of the given type. usage: <scheme starting character> = start_scheme = { type = X contract = (Optional) CONTRACT target_character = (*) CHARACTER target_title = (*)TITLE target_culture = (*)CULTURE target_faith = (*)FAITH targets_nothing = (*) yes/no (default no) save_scope_as = (Optional) NAME <----- } } (*) Only one target can be specified (or 0 if target_nothing = yes). Supported Scopes: character is it really possible to do that now? i dont see any vanilla example using save_scope_as inside a start scheme the begin_scheme effect use this convoluted method to store the scope begin_scheme_basic_effect = { # Log our scheme launcher so that we can refer to them down the line. save_scope_as = scheme_launcher # Log all the currently on-going schemes. ## We do it this way being we can't guarantee mutually exclusive targets with non-character scheme targets any more: we can't just look for "X's murder scheme against Y", because X might be plotting against no target whatsoever and have multiple schemes of that type against nothing. every_scheme = { add_to_list = current_schemes_list } # Now start the scheme. start_scheme = { type = $SCHEME_TYPE$ $TARGET_TYPE$ = $TARGET_SCOPE$ } # And grab the scheme's scope. random_scheme = { limit = { NOT = { is_in_list = current_schemes_list } } save_scope_as = new_scheme } scope:new_scheme ?= { # If we have a custom charge threshold to complete, set that here. ## Sway. if = { limit = { scheme_type = sway } set_variable = { name = custom_charge_threshold value = 5 } } } }
KeizerHarm | T4N 11/29/2025 6:56 AM
It's possible the script you mention predates the save_scope_as parameter and wasn't updated with it. You can just test it out
1

6:58 AM

6:58 AM

Overload Ru 11/29/2025 7:25 AM
Gameplay. so I load up the game I joined my father‚Äôs house. I signed myself as a secret bastard but how do I assign myself a mother?
Pep 11/29/2025 7:25 AM
scope:my_character = { set_mother = father.primary_spouse }
1
7:26 AM
Though if you are a bastard you want a different mother, so scope:my_character = { set_mother = scope:my_mother }

Pep 11/29/2025 7:32 AM

If it was me, I would 1) use set_real_father to be a bastard 2) use set_mother to gain a mother 3) use set_house = real_father.house to join my sperm donor's house However people like me and Canny don't like dangling orphans floating about in dynasty trees because it looks horrid and even though ck3 is ahistorical makes no sense, because how does a child just magically appear in a dynasty? (edited)

Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:20 AM
Hello. I'm creating quite an ambitious mod atm. I however, as a beginner Ck3 modder, am not sure about this on_action I'm trying to create. Purpose is to give on_siege_completion every knight and commander trait xp on a number of traits if they have one such trait. I made this code in the pic. question, Is this a valid code that targets knights and commander in army?
Canny 11/29/2025 9:23 AM
you are missing a limit on an if and the trigger logic for the on_action looks off
Agami 11/29/2025 9:23 AM
also a missing = after on_siege_completion
1
1
Canny 11/29/2025 9:25 AM
I think you should remove trigger altogether and let the effect handle the conditionals
Agami 11/29/2025 9:27 AM
I don't see scope:army listed for this on_action (edited)
9:28 AM
if you open the game file with it, the comments above say what scopes are pre-saved from code you can just remove scope:army.army_owner since that's the root of the on_action already, the occupant granted, then you'd probably need to check with all armies in the province whether the knights are on one of them (edited)
Canny
I think you should remove trigger altogether and let the effect handle the conditionals
Pep 11/29/2025 9:28 AM
nah the root of the on_action is the occupant, so it's a quick fail if they are only giving xp for those traits to knights if the primary attacker/defender has those traits.
Pep
nah the root of the on_action is the occupant, so it's a quick fail if they are only giving xp for those traits to knights if the primary attacker/defender has those traits.
Canny 11/29/2025 9:29 AM
gotcha, seems I misunderstood it
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:30 AM
thanks for the quick replies, it helps a lot. The goal is that a knight or commander that was in the army on siege completion, gains trait xp for the trait they have but only if they have one of the 6 listed traits (edited)
Nasansoturi
thanks for the quick replies, it helps a lot. The goal is that a knight or commander that was in the army on siege completion, gains trait xp for the trait they have but only if they have one of the 6 listed traits (edited)
Pep 11/29/2025 9:32 AM
But there is a crucial question here, which is a point between myself and Canny. The way you have that setup, it will only enter the on_action body and give xp to knights with those traits IF the owner of the army also has those traits. Is that what you intend, if not then as Canny said, remove the on_action trigger, otherwise leave it as is. (edited)
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:33 AM
It should not matter if the army owner has one of the traits or not. Its just simple if you have a trait = you get xp
Pep 11/29/2025 9:34 AM
Then you need to remove the on_action trigger.
1
Canny
gotcha, seems I misunderstood it
Pep 11/29/2025 9:35 AM
Seems that was not their intent, so as always it's great to discuss someone's design and pull it apart
Kyte 11/29/2025 9:36 AM
Hey, I look forward to you all telling me why my mod design sucks lol
Kyte
Hey, I look forward to you all telling me why my mod design sucks lol
Pep 11/29/2025 9:37 AM
Because it's bad
Canny 11/29/2025 9:37 AM
for the knights, you can use this condition instead for every_knight: location = scope:barony.title_province
9:39 AM
since scope:army doesnt seem to exist
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:44 AM
by far on_action s have been the hardest part to do. particularily I'm having trouble with defining who this targets. traits, decisions, simple events, interactions, maa's were quite easy compared to ts. does location = scope:barony.title_province target the location where the army is or? where the siege was completed or? I'm quite confused lol (edited)
Canny 11/29/2025 9:46 AM
most built-in on_actions already have associated scopes provided
9:47 AM
location = scope:barony.title_province this basically checks if the current scope (in this case, the knight) is in the province that was just occupied.
9:48 AM
scope:barony is the scope provided by the on_action but it is a title and location is asking for a province so I added a title_province to turn it into a province. (edited)
9:51 AM
alternatively, you can use knight_army to see if any of the army on the location (every_army_in_location) is one of them
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:53 AM
Thank you, so, how does this look? Do I remove the exists = knight_army form limit?
Canny 11/29/2025 9:55 AM
Nope, location = scope:barony.title_province is a trigger so it should be in the limit block. add back the every_knight scope and put location = scope:barony.title_province under it's limit
1
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 9:59 AM
cultivation_xp_on_action = { effect = { every_knight = { if = { limit = { location = scope:barony.title_province exists = knight_army OR = { has_trait = qi_gathering has_trait = core_formation has_trait = golden_core has_trait = peak_realm has_trait = unrestrained_realm has_trait = immortal_realm } } add_trait_xp = { trait = qi_gathering value = 1 } add_trait_xp = { trait = core_formation value = 3 } add_trait_xp = { trait = golden_core value = 2 } add_trait_xp = { trait = peak_realm value = 2 } add_trait_xp = { trait = unrestrained_realm value = 1 } add_trait_xp = { trait = immortal_realm value = 1 } } }
9:59 AM
like this?
Nasansoturi
cultivation_xp_on_action = { effect = { every_knight = { if = { limit = { location = scope:barony.title_province exists = knight_army OR = { has_trait = qi_gathering has_trait = core_formation has_trait = golden_core has_trait = peak_realm has_trait = unrestrained_realm has_trait = immortal_realm } } add_trait_xp = { trait = qi_gathering value = 1 } add_trait_xp = { trait = core_formation value = 3 } add_trait_xp = { trait = golden_core value = 2 } add_trait_xp = { trait = peak_realm value = 2 } add_trait_xp = { trait = unrestrained_realm value = 1 } add_trait_xp = { trait = immortal_realm value = 1 } } }
Pep 11/29/2025 10:04 AM
That looks okay, except you are testing if they have one of those traits but then giving them xp for all those traits, regardless if they actually have the trait. Inside the body, for each trait you should add the xp within a IF if = { limit = { has_trait = qi_gathering } add_trait_xp = { trait = qi_gathering value = 1 } } if = { limit = { has_trait = core_formation } add_trait_xp = { trait = core_formation value = 3 } } etc
Pep
That looks okay, except you are testing if they have one of those traits but then giving them xp for all those traits, regardless if they actually have the trait. Inside the body, for each trait you should add the xp within a IF if = { limit = { has_trait = qi_gathering } add_trait_xp = { trait = qi_gathering value = 1 } } if = { limit = { has_trait = core_formation } add_trait_xp = { trait = core_formation value = 3 } } etc
Nasansoturi 11/29/2025 10:05 AM
alright thank you this was what I was intending.
Pep 11/29/2025 10:05 AM
Wait.
10:09 AM
There's something fundamentally wrong with that whole thing. every_, random_ and ordered_ list builders have a limit which is better for performance than using a internal if within their body. Change that so the inner if limit is the every_knight's limit and then remove the inner if = {}, leaving just it's body, like this cultivation_xp_on_action = { effect = { every_knight = { limit = { location = scope:barony.title_province exists = knight_army OR = { has_trait = qi_gathering has_trait = core_formation has_trait = golden_core has_trait = peak_realm has_trait = unrestrained_realm has_trait = immortal_realm } } # Then do the trait xp here like I said, within their own `IF` } (edited)
1
1

10:30 AM

fx4d
alr i'll try the dna thing in the character files
Pep 11/29/2025 10:31 AM
Easiest way to do this is 1) create your bookmark ruler in ruler designer 2) copy the persistent record and place that as your bookmark character's dna in common/bookmark_portraits, changing the key to whatever you use in your bookmark 3) copy a existing common/dna_data record as a template and change the key to the one you will use for your history character 4) remove the genes = {} block from the dna record in (3) 5) copy the genes = {} block from the persistent dna record in (2) and paste it in the dna record in (3) that you deleted in (4) 6) add the dna key from (3) to the character's history record using dna = (edited)
fx4d 11/29/2025 10:32 AM
ok
Pep 11/29/2025 10:32 AM
Following that check list, your bookmark character and game character will have the same dna you created in ruler designer. (edited)
fx4d 11/29/2025 10:33 AM
okay, so start the game without the 1337 bm and the regular vanilla ones?
Pep 11/29/2025 10:33 AM
To create the ruler dna in ruler designer? If so you can start in any year, it doesn't matter, you can get to ruler designer from any date.

Kyte 11/29/2025 1:09 PM
I'm trying to add a trait to every member of my dynasty on birth. Single player only so should be fine. Will the following work or is there a better way to do this? my_child_birth_on_actions.txt # should append to on_birth_child on_birth_child = { on_actions = { add_my_trait } } add_my_trait = { if = { limit = { any_dynasty_member = { is_ai = no } } add_trait = my_trait } }
Canny 11/29/2025 1:10 PM
limit = { dynasty = { any_dynasty_member = { is_ai = no } } }
1:11 PM
you need to put the if in an effect block too
Kyte 11/29/2025 1:14 PM
Alright, this is what I got now add_trait_to_dynasty_members = { effect = { if = { limit = { dynasty = { any_dynasty_member = { is_ai = no } } } add_trait = my_trait } } }
1:14 PM
I would love to make this a pop-up decision, but this is a good start
a 11/29/2025 1:18 PM
or put the condition as a trigger in your add_my_trait hook
1:18 PM
you're also not dealing with the funny stuff like real_fathers and lowborn children
Kyte 11/29/2025 1:19 PM
the first pass at this is very understanding of life's circumstances
Kyte 11/29/2025 1:50 PM
hmm, that didn't work. The trait has the following modifiers to disable the AI from using them birth = 0 random_creation = 0 random_creation_weight = 0
1:51 PM
So maybe that defintion is preventing the trait from being set? More likely the add_trait_to_dynasty_members is incorrect
a 11/29/2025 2:49 PM
that wouldn't matter since you're using add_trait
2:50 PM
and those random spawn weights are not used at all unless you configured the trait to be genetic
Kyte 11/29/2025 2:59 PM
Right you are. I checked my error log and it looks like a save operation overwrote the "yaml with bom" setting.
a 11/29/2025 2:59 PM
and think about whether you actually need a trait in the first place
2:59 PM
if you just need a stats buff, you can add a modifier to the entire dynasty
1
Kyte 11/29/2025 3:00 PM
It's a leveled trait and I want it on each dynasty member.
Kyte
Alright, this is what I got now add_trait_to_dynasty_members = { effect = { if = { limit = { dynasty = { any_dynasty_member = { is_ai = no } } } add_trait = my_trait } } }
Kyte 11/29/2025 7:15 PM
This was correct, thank you @a !

Pep 11/30/2025 9:04 AM
Change your debug_log to debug_log = "Reducing all budgets for [THIS.Char.GetNameNoTooltip]" Then run the mod and see who it's running for.
Galle 11/30/2025 9:04 AM
Checking the documentation answers my question!
9:04 AM
"Note that it happens concurrently to events triggered by the on_action, NOT before. Effects run here create a separate chain than events the on_action fires, so you can for example not manipulate values in the effect, and then reliably access those in an event that was fired at the same time. Scopes or local variables set in the effect here will not carry over to any event fired by the on_action."
9:04 AM
Whoops
9:04 AM
Guess I have to call the event from effect instead
Pep 11/30/2025 9:07 AM

Galle 11/30/2025 9:07 AM

Pep 11/30/2025 9:07 AM

9:08 AM
omg you wrote your on_action upside down.
9:09 AM
The norm is to write them so events = {} and random_events = {} etc are first, then the trigger and effect. So I naturally didn't read further because it looked like a simple effect only on_action, otherwise I would have seen the issue

Canny
you can do this instead NOR = { has_trait = trait1 has_trait = trait2 has_trait = trait3 has_trait = trait4 has_trait = trait5 }
Pep 11/30/2025 10:16 AM
This is a perfect example of things that bug me with Paradox. In AUH they refactored has_variable so you can do has_variable = { var_1 var_2 var_3 ... } And has_trait is something commonly repeated, as you have done but they did not refactor has_trait similar to has_variable I know the reason behind the has_variable refactor was performance, the theory being that the group check is more efficient than multiple single checks but surely that would also be true for something like has_trait
Canny 11/30/2025 10:18 AM
I didnt even know has_variable changed lol
1
Pep 11/30/2025 10:19 AM
Yeah but unlike other triggers it is not implicit AND, that syntax is implicit OR
Canny 11/30/2025 10:19 AM
that is not intuitive
1
Pep 11/30/2025 10:19 AM
has_variable - Checks whether the current scope has any of the specified variables set has_variable = variable_name has_variable = { name = variable_name1 name = variable_name2 name = variable_name3 } Supported Scopes: none
10:20 AM
Note has any of the specified variables set

Canny 11/30/2025 11:15 AM
set_father = char_scope and then set_house = father should do it
Myphicbowser 11/30/2025 11:16 AM

Canny 11/30/2025 11:17 AM
option = { scope:child = { set_father = ROOT set_house = father.house } }
Myphicbowser 11/30/2025 11:17 AM
Oh I think I get it!
Canny 11/30/2025 11:17 AM
assuming the event triggers on the father and the child's scope is saved

Canny 11/30/2025 11:58 AM
there it is, the first one, you forgot to put it in a trigger
11:58 AM
usually, for syntax error, the first error causes the rest for a file so just check the first
Nasansoturi 11/30/2025 12:00 PM
its in option = { name = advancement_events.0001.b NOT = { is_ai = yes } } (edited)
12:00 PM
what would be better to condition that option only for player?
fx4d 11/30/2025 12:01 PM
hello
1
Canny 11/30/2025 12:01 PM
option = { name = advancement_events.0001.b trigger = { NOT = { is_ai = yes } } } the error is basically saying you need to put conditions in a trigger block like so
12:02 PM
option = { name = advancement_events.0001.b trigger = { is_ai = no } } this also works
Nasansoturi 11/30/2025 12:03 PM

Canny 11/30/2025 12:50 PM
first, search the error logs for every mention of spawn_cultivator_events.txt. Start with the earliest error since one error tend to cause more down the line. Every error usually tells you the line number of where the error start near line: ### on the file, go to that line and check it

Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings
They upgraded from 32 bits to 64 bits and shifted a bit more
Five | Rank & File 11/30/2025 8:09 PM
Don't mean to necro an old comment but I haven't found anyhting newer... can we use 64 bit numbers in game? I had assumed that we were limited to 32 bits since they're called "int32"
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/30/2025 8:10 PM
Scriptside all numbers are 64-bit CFixedPoints
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings
Scriptside all numbers are 64-bit CFixedPoints
Five | Rank & File 11/30/2025 8:12 PM
Does that actually mean I could use a 2^64 number? Or do we lose some of that for negative values or decimals?
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 11/30/2025 8:13 PM
You lose a bunch to decimals
8:13 PM
Like 10^9 or so
8:13 PM
Dunno how far the shift really is these days
8:13 PM
But under the hood it's a signed 64-bit integer
Five | Rank & File 11/30/2025 8:15 PM
Hmmmm trying to see hnow much dat I could encode into a value
8:15 PM
I've successfully done up to 16 bit numbers before but I haven't tried to go higher
Nasansoturi
How can I limit a decision to a single Heritage or region like eastern Asia? ex. In is_valid block?
Pep 12/1/2025 3:44 AM
Character's location region location = { geographical_region = world_asia_east } Character's capital region capital_province = { geographical_region = world_asia_east } Character's heritage culture = { has_cultural_pillar = heritage_byzantine } Should be in root scope in is_valid so no need to link them to root
1
Nasansoturi 12/1/2025 3:46 AM
Thank you, appreciated:)
Five | Rank & File
Hmmmm trying to see hnow much dat I could encode into a value
KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 7:07 AM
https://discord.com/channels/735413460439007241/735413461680652365/1266066394928250911 I got my ability encoding system to reliably work with numbers up to 900 million, and up to 4 decimal places. (edited)
7:07 AM
It's less than you'd expect but going larger or smaller became unreliable.
KeizerHarm | T4N
https://discord.com/channels/735413460439007241/735413461680652365/1266066394928250911 I got my ability encoding system to reliably work with numbers up to 900 million, and up to 4 decimal places. (edited)

doormat03 12/1/2025 12:16 PM
Does anyone know how to give a title a certain name and/or Coat of arms if a character of a certain religion, culture, or dynasty controls it? Like how France is called West Francia if controlled by the Karlings. I've tried looking it up, but I can't seem to find any information about this.
doormat03
Does anyone know how to give a title a certain name and/or Coat of arms if a character of a certain religion, culture, or dynasty controls it? Like how France is called West Francia if controlled by the Karlings. I've tried looking it up, but I can't seem to find any information about this.
Canny 12/1/2025 12:19 PM
there's a set_coa to change the coat of arms and set_title_name for title names. You'd need a way to trigger them thou, on_action, decision, event, etc.
King Spork 12/1/2025 2:51 PM
Is this the correct/best way to use a portrait modifier to remove a character's hat? (not hair): dna_modifiers = { accessory = { mode = remove gene = headgear range = { 0 1 } # For the randomness to work correctly } }

Is this the correct/best way to use a portrait modifier to remove a character's hat? (not hair): dna_modifiers = { accessory = { mode = remove gene = headgear range = { 0 1 } # For the randomness to work correctly } }
KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 2:58 PM

.moka

KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 3:01 PM
common/decisions/dlc_decisions/ep_3/06_ep3_laamp_decisions.txt
1
.moka 12/1/2025 3:02 PM
ah! thank you so much
KeizerHarm | T4N
I have never seen mode = remove before
King Spork 12/1/2025 3:03 PM
@KeizerHarm | T4N Do you know the correct way to do this? I believe mode = remove was mentioned in the docs or on the wiki but I could be mistaken.
King Spork
Is this the correct/best way to use a portrait modifier to remove a character's hat? (not hair): dna_modifiers = { accessory = { mode = remove gene = headgear range = { 0 1 } # For the randomness to work correctly } }
KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 3:03 PM
The right way is: accessory = { mode = add gene = headgear template = no_headgear value = 0.5 }
1
1
King Spork 12/1/2025 3:03 PM
Thank you so much
KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 3:04 PM
No problem. For putting specific garments, the all_historical_characters file is your friend
1
King Spork 12/1/2025 3:12 PM
Another question: is there any methodical way to determine the values I should use for my portrait modifier weights? Or do people just throw in "big" or "small" values and hope for the best? I'm not really sure on the difference in impact between add = 50 and add = 1000
King Spork
Another question: is there any methodical way to determine the values I should use for my portrait modifier weights? Or do people just throw in "big" or "small" values and hope for the best? I'm not really sure on the difference in impact between add = 50 and add = 1000
KeizerHarm | T4N 12/1/2025 3:14 PM
I always start from a vanilla value. For example if I want to add a new crown I'll look at vanilla crowns; if it's a special crown I'll look at vanilla special crowns like the Reichskrone, etcetera
1

Nasansoturi

If no - replace 00_holdings.txt and add my own buildings inside, alongside base game ones? = causing mod compatibility issues, yes?
Immortal_Hybrid - CK3AGOT, LOTR 12/1/2025 6:48 PM
No
1
Dr Tobbzn | Way of Kings 12/1/2025 8:27 PM
Sort of - you can override the top-level block (the holding type) from another file but you'll always have incompatibility with other mods. (edited)
8:27 PM
For most modders it's not worth giving up on comparison tools on patch day like winmerge or git merge
Pundx | Communion & Denomination 12/1/2025 9:13 PM
I've noticed that in several places Paradox has switched from using numbers to indicate title tier to using "tier_x". Does continued use of the numbers cause issues? See example of what I mean below. Old: highest_held_title_tier = 2 New: highest_held_title_tier = tier_county (edited)
9:14 PM
Excuse me if it's an old change.
Pundx | Communion & Denomination
I've noticed that in several places Paradox has switched from using numbers to indicate title tier to using "tier_x". Does continued use of the numbers cause issues? See example of what I mean below. Old: highest_held_title_tier = 2 New: highest_held_title_tier = tier_county (edited)
Immortal_Hybrid - CK3AGOT, LOTR 12/1/2025 9:16 PM
It does not
9:16 PM
tier_county is just easier to read than 2
Pundx | Communion & Denomination 12/1/2025 9:16 PM
